commit_message:
L2Gateway Service Plugin

This patch set implements RPC calls that are initiated by the
L2 gateway agent destined to the L2 gateway service plugin

Author: Phani Pawan <ppawan@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Manjunath Patil <mpatil@hp.com>

Change-Id: If0db38aad3706265b89b972efe7b29cffcb5e10e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-l2gw refs/changes/66/148866/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 OpenStack Foundation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from oslo.config import cfg from networking_l2gw.services.l2gateway.common import constants from networking_l2gw.services.l2gateway.common import topics from networking_l2gw.services.l2gateway import ovsdb_db as db from neutron.common import rpc as n_rpc from neutron.db import agents_db from neutron.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class L2GatewayCallbacks(n_rpc.RpcCallback): """Implement the rpc call back functions in this class.""" RPC_API_VERSION = '1.0' def __init__(self, plugin): super(L2GatewayCallbacks, self).__init__() self.plugin = plugin self.agent_rpc = L2gatewayAgentApi(topics.L2GATEWAY_AGENT, cfg.CONF.host) def update_ovsdb_changes(self, context, ovsdb_data): """RPC to update the changes from OVSDB in the database.""" ovsdb_identifier = ovsdb_data.get('ovsdb_identifier') if ovsdb_data.get('new_logical_switches'): self._process_new_logical_switches( context, ovsdb_data.get('new_logical_switches'), ovsdb_identifier) if ovsdb_data.get('new_physical_ports'): self._process_new_physical_ports( context, ovsdb_data.get('new_physical_ports'), ovsdb_identifier) if ovsdb_data.get('new_physical_switches'): self._process_new_physical_switches( context, ovsdb_data.get('new_physical_switches'), ovsdb_identifier) if ovsdb_data.get('new_physical_locators'): self._process_new_physical_locators( context, ovsdb_data.get('new_physical_locators'), ovsdb_identifier) if ovsdb_data.get('new_local_macs'): self._process_new_local_macs( context, ovsdb_data.get('new_local_macs'), ovsdb_identifier) if ovsdb_data.get('new_remote_macs'): self._process_new_remote_macs( context, ovsdb_data.get('new_remote_macs'), ovsdb_identifier) if ovsdb_data.get('modified_physical_ports'): self._process_modified_physical_ports( context, ovsdb_data.get('modified_physical_ports'), ovsdb_identifier) if ovsdb_data.get('deleted_logical_switches'): self._process_deleted_logical_switches( context, ovsdb_data.get('deleted_logical_switches'), ovsdb_identifier) if ovsdb_data.get('deleted_physical_switches'): self._process_deleted_physical_switches( context, ovsdb_data.get('deleted_physical_switches'), ovsdb_identifier) if ovsdb_data.get('deleted_physical_ports'): self._process_deleted_physical_ports( context, ovsdb_data.get('deleted_physical_ports'), ovsdb_identifier) if ovsdb_data.get('deleted_physical_locators'): self._process_deleted_physical_locators( context, ovsdb_data.get('deleted_physical_locators'), ovsdb_identifier) if ovsdb_data.get('deleted_local_macs'): self._process_deleted_local_macs( context, ovsdb_data.get('deleted_local_macs'), ovsdb_identifier) if ovsdb_data.get('deleted_remote_macs'): self._process_deleted_remote_macs( context, ovsdb_data.get('deleted_remote_macs'), ovsdb_identifier) return def _process_new_logical_switches(self, context, new_logical_switches, ovsdb_identifier): for logical_switch in new_logical_switches: ls_dict = logical_switch ls_dict['ovsdb_identifier'] = ovsdb_identifier l_switch = db.get_logical_switch(context, ls_dict) if not l_switch: db.add_logical_switch(context, ls_dict) def _process_new_physical_switches(self, context, new_physical_switches, ovsdb_identifier): for physical_switch in new_physical_switches: ps_dict = physical_switch ps_dict['ovsdb_identifier'] = ovsdb_identifier if (ps_dict.get('tunnel_ip'))[0] == 'set': ps_dict['tunnel_ip'] = None p_switch = db.get_physical_switch(context, ps_dict) if not p_switch: db.add_physical_switch(context, ps_dict) def _process_new_physical_ports(self, context, new_physical_ports, ovsdb_identifier): for physical_port in new_physical_ports: pp_dict = physical_port pp_dict['ovsdb_identifier'] = ovsdb_identifier p_port = db.get_physical_port(context, pp_dict) if not p_port: db.add_physical_port(context, pp_dict) if pp_dict.get('vlan_bindings'): for vlan_binding in pp_dict.get('vlan_bindings'): vlan_binding['ovsdb_identifier'] = ovsdb_identifier vlan_binding['port_uuid'] = pp_dict.get('uuid') v_binding = db.get_vlan_binding(context, vlan_binding) if not v_binding: db.add_vlan_binding(context, vlan_binding) def _process_new_physical_locators(self, context, new_physical_locators, ovsdb_identifier): for physical_locator in new_physical_locators: pl_dict = physical_locator pl_dict['ovsdb_identifier'] = ovsdb_identifier p_locator = db.get_physical_locator(context, pl_dict) if not p_locator: db.add_physical_locator(context, pl_dict) def _process_new_local_macs(self, context, new_local_macs, ovsdb_identifier): for local_mac in new_local_macs: lm_dict = local_mac lm_dict['ovsdb_identifier'] = ovsdb_identifier lm_dict['logical_switch_uuid'] = local_mac.get('logical_switch_id') l_mac = db.get_ucast_mac_local(context, lm_dict) if not l_mac: db.add_ucast_mac_local(context, lm_dict) def _process_new_remote_macs(self, context, new_remote_macs, ovsdb_identifier): for remote_mac in new_remote_macs: rm_dict = remote_mac rm_dict['ovsdb_identifier'] = ovsdb_identifier r_mac = db.get_ucast_mac_remote(context, rm_dict) if not r_mac: db.add_ucast_mac_remote(context, rm_dict) def _process_modified_physical_ports(self, context, modified_physical_ports, ovsdb_identifier): for physical_port in modified_physical_ports: pp_dict = physical_port pp_dict['ovsdb_identifier'] = ovsdb_identifier modified_port = db.get_physical_port(context, pp_dict) if modified_port: port_vlan_bindings = physical_port.get('vlan_bindings') vlan_bindings = db.get_vlan_bindings_by_physical_port(context, pp_dict) for vlan_binding in vlan_bindings: db.delete_vlan_binding(context, vlan_binding) for port_vlan_binding in port_vlan_bindings: port_vlan_binding['port_uuid'] = pp_dict['uuid'] port_vlan_binding['ovsdb_identifier'] = ovsdb_identifier db.add_vlan_binding(context, port_vlan_binding) else: db.add_physical_port(context, pp_dict) def _process_deleted_logical_switches(self, context, deleted_logical_switches, ovsdb_identifier): for logical_switch in deleted_logical_switches: ls_dict = logical_switch ls_dict['ovsdb_identifier'] = ovsdb_identifier db.delete_logical_switch(context, ls_dict) def _process_deleted_physical_switches(self, context, deleted_physical_switches, ovsdb_identifier): for physical_switch in deleted_physical_switches: ps_dict = physical_switch ps_dict['ovsdb_identifier'] = ovsdb_identifier db.delete_logical_switch(context, ps_dict) def _process_deleted_physical_ports(self, context, deleted_physical_ports, ovsdb_identifier): for physical_port in deleted_physical_ports: pp_dict = physical_port pp_dict['ovsdb_identifier'] = ovsdb_identifier db.delete_physical_port(context, pp_dict) def _process_deleted_physical_locators(self, context, deleted_physical_locators, ovsdb_identifier): for physical_locator in deleted_physical_locators: pl_dict = physical_locator pl_dict['ovsdb_identifier'] = ovsdb_identifier db.delete_physical_locator(context, pl_dict) def _process_deleted_local_macs(self, context, deleted_local_macs, ovsdb_identifier): for local_mac in deleted_local_macs: lm_dict = local_mac lm_dict['ovsdb_identifier'] = ovsdb_identifier db.delete_ucast_mac_local(context, lm_dict) def _process_deleted_remote_macs(self, context, deleted_remote_macs, ovsdb_identifier): for remote_mac in deleted_remote_macs: rm_dict = remote_mac rm_dict['ovsdb_identifier'] = ovsdb_identifier db.delete_ucast_mac_remote(context, rm_dict) class L2gatewayAgentApi(n_rpc.RpcProxy): """L2 gateway Plugin side of plugin to agent RPC API.""" API_VERSION = '1.0' def __init__(self, topic, host): super(L2gatewayAgentApi, self).__init__(topic, self.API_VERSION) self.host = host def set_l2gateway_agent_type(self, context, host, payload): """RPC to select Monitor/Transact agent.""" self.cast( context, self.make_msg('set_l2gateway_agent_type', type_dict=payload), topic='%s.%s' % (topics.L2GATEWAY_AGENT, host)) def insert_vm_mac(self, context, record_dict): """RPC to enter the VM MAC details inside the OVSDB.""" self.cast(context, self.make_msg('insert_vm_mac', record_dict=record_dict) ) def delete_vm_mac(self, context, record_dict): """RPC to delete the VM MAC details inside the OVSDB.""" self.cast(context, self.make_msg('delete_vm_mac', record_dict=record_dict) ) def delete_network(self, context, record_dict): """RPC to delete the Network inside the OVSDB.""" self.cast(context, self.make_msg('delete_network', record_dict=record_dict) ) def update_connection_to_gateway(self, context, record_dict): """RPC to update the connection to OVSDB.""" self.cast(context, self.make_msg('update_connection_to_gateway', record_dict=record_dict) ) class L2GatewayPlugin(): """Implementation of the Neutron l2 gateway Service Plugin. This class manages the workflow of L2 gateway request/response. """ supported_extension_aliases = ["l2-gateway", "ovsdb-endpoint", "l2-gateway-connection"] def __init__(self): """Do the initialization for the l2 gateway service plugin here.""" self.endpoints = [L2GatewayCallbacks(self), agents_db.AgentExtRpcCallback()] self.conn = n_rpc.create_connection(new=True) self.conn.create_consumer(topics.L2GATEWAY_PLUGIN, self.endpoints, fanout=False) self.conn.consume_in_threads() self.agent_rpc = L2gatewayAgentApi(topics.L2GATEWAY_AGENT, cfg.CONF.host) super(L2GatewayPlugin, self).__init__() def insert_ucast_macs_in_ovsdb(self, context, port_dict): pass def delete_ucast_macs_in_ovsdb(self, context, port_dict): pass def create_l2_gateway_connection(self, context, l2_gateway_connection): pass def delete_l2_gateway_connection(self, context, l2_gateway_connection): pass def get_plugin_type(self): return constants.L2GW def get_plugin_description(self): return "Neutron L2 gateway Service Plugin"

commit_message:
processutils: execute(): fix option incompatibility

Issue: simultaneous usage of 'shell' and 'run_as_root' options led
to error.

Cause: it's actually a concealed TypeError: in 'shell'
mode the command argument is assumed to be a string, elsewhere
a list/tuple.

Fix: the command editing implied by 'run_as_root' is performed
with care taken of above tacit type assumption.

Change-Id: Iaba33e6fda67793ae2874ba278c990271ee5e47f
Closes-Bug: #1382873
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.concurrency refs/changes/33/147033/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_as_root(self): out, err = processutils.execute('a', 'b', 'c', run_as_root=True, root_helper='echo') self.assertEqual(u'a b c\n', out) def test_as_root_via_shell(self): out, err = processutils.execute('a b c', run_as_root=True, root_helper='echo', shell=True) self.assertEqual(u'a b c\n', out)

commit_message:
Cleanup readme to offer more sane defaults

While the readme is just walking through an example dev/test setup,
it is still important to provide sane options here. This CR fixes
some items to make this more in line with current accepted defaults:

- Use AES128 instead of DES3 for key encryption
- Use example.com for all example domain names
- Make self signed root cert generation more clear
- Use a sane number of bits for RSA keys

Change-Id: I8d3730e1810cb0216f048960e437e8eff1f916f0

Now generate a valid CSR that should pass validation and'anchor-test.example.com' when prompted: openssl req -text -newkey rsa:4096 -nodes \ -out anchor-test.example.com.csr -F encoding=pem -F 'csr=<anchor-test.example.com.csr'

commit_message:
Don't try to convert LDAP attributes to boolean

Currently, in the ldap2py function, attribute values are attempted
to be converted to python friendly types.

It attempts to convert an attribute to boolean first, then fallback
as string. Any attribute value that is equal to 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
are converted to boolean value.

Only 'enabled' attribute require this type of handling, and it is
already by enabled2py function. The additional handling on ldap2py
function should be removed.

Change-Id: Ifd1e91f98ae22a5e5f7b9b2ddbfddba156e16a6d
Closes-Bug: #1411478
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/22/154722/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_create_user_with_boolean_string_names(self): # Ensure that any attribute that is equal to the string 'TRUE' # or 'FALSE' will not be converted to a boolean value, it # should be returned as is. boolean_strings = ['TRUE', 'FALSE'] for name in boolean_strings: user = { 'name': name, 'domain_id': CONF.identity.default_domain_id} user_ref = self.identity_api.create_user(user) user_info = self.identity_api.get_user(user_ref['id']) self.assertEqual(name, user_info['name'])

Use get_virtual_environment() to get nodes in store_astute_yaml()

get_virtual_environment() for get the list of nodes().

commit_message:
Replace start_guests with resume_guests

This commit changes the nova.conf entry from start_guests_on_boot
to resume_guets_state_on_host_boot for compute nodes.

Change-Id: I5c6835f3852eae90ed40429635ff38d36e256c6c
Partial-Bug: #1352284
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/72/148872/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nova_config { 'DEFAULT/resume_guests_state_on_host_boot': value => $::fuel_settings['resume_guests_state_on_host_boot'] }

commit_message:
Allow running individual tests via tox

Allow passing a test module name via the tox command line to allow
running individual tests.

Change-Id: Iff551d054e2a8252f437f6756760cd4418abcfa4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/django_openstack_auth refs/changes/41/154341/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = python openstack_auth/tests/run_tests.py {posargs} python openstack_auth/tests/run_tests.py {posargs} python openstack_auth/tests/run_tests.py {posargs}
deleted_lines: commands = python openstack_auth/tests/run_tests.py python openstack_auth/tests/run_tests.py python openstack_auth/tests/run_tests.py

commit_message:
VMware: add in a utility method for detaching devices

Add in a method detach_devices_from_vm for detaching devices from
a VM.

Change-Id: I30ee4fef6f33875d398a51c2d92f2c67c998f89e
Partial-bug: #1407050
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/81/144881/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _detach_devices_config_spec(client_factory, devices): config_spec = client_factory.create('ns0:VirtualMachineConfigSpec') device_config_spec = [] for device in devices: virtual_device_config = client_factory.create( 'ns0:VirtualDeviceConfigSpec') virtual_device_config.operation = "remove" virtual_device_config.device = device device_config_spec.append(virtual_device_config) config_spec.deviceChange = device_config_spec return config_spec def detach_devices_from_vm(session, vm_ref, devices): """Detach specified devices from VM.""" client_factory = session.vim.client.factory config_spec = _detach_devices_config_spec(client_factory, devices) reconfigure_vm(session, vm_ref, config_spec)

5. VM deletion is simple

Make use of the same VM for the rezie

Change-Id: Ibcb108c2e0f84a84c599d2e7762a11efc7659395
Closes-bug: #1407438
Closes-bug: #1407050
'}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2015-02-02 17:38:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5e524934decf91b147ba6c18561ebe39a5571fa0', 'message': 'VMware: address instance resize problems

The resize code in the driver is problematic. This stems
from the fact that a clone of the VM takes place. There are
a number of know issues with this:
1. resize selects an invalid datastore (bug 1407438)
2. resize may fail when a selected host does not have access
   to the datastore that has the config driver file (bug
   1407050)
3. resized instances are not marked as owned by OpenStack on the
   VC (bug 1402784)

In fact we could do the resize on the existing VM. This has the
following advantages:
1. it does not need an additional VM
2. it fixes the bugs that are mentioned above
3. It is now far simpler and more robust
4. It does not require convoluted instance naming and tracking
5. VM deletion is simple
6. enables better test covergae

The patch makes use of the same VM for resizing.

Methods no longer used have been removed. These methods were
specific to the old resize.

Co-authored-by: Radoslav Gerganov <rgerganov@vmware.com>

Change-Id: Ibcb108c2e0f84a84c599d2e7762a11efc7659395
Closes-bug: #1407438
Closes-bug: #1407050
Closes-bug: #1402784
'}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2015-02-08 19:18:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/fcf044b9817eeeaafa2d24166df1de0dec59771a', 'message': 'VMware: address instance resize problems

   VC (bug 1402784)

In fact we could do the resize on the existing VM. This has the
following advantages:
1. it does not need an additional VM
2. it fixes the bugs that are mentioned above
3. It is now far simpler and more robust
4. It does not require convoluted instance naming and tracking
5. VM deletion is simple
6. enables better test covergae

The patch makes use of the same VM for resizing.

Methods no longer used have been removed. These methods were
specific to the old resize.

Co-authored-by: Radoslav Gerganov <rgerganov@vmware.com>

Change-Id: Ibcb108c2e0f84a84c599d2e7762a11efc7659395
Closes-bug: #1407438

commit_message:
VMware: address instance resize problems

The resize code in the driver is problematic. This stems
from the fact that a clone of the VM takes place. There are
a number of know issues with this:
1. resize selects an invalid datastore (bug 1407438)
2. resize may fail when a selected host does not have access
   to the datastore that has the config driver file (bug
   1407050)
3. resized instances are not marked as owned by OpenStack on the
   VC (bug 1402784)

In fact we could do the resize on the existing VM. This has the
following advantages:
1. it does not need an additional VM
2. it fixes the bugs that are mentioned above
3. It is now far simpler and more robust
4. It does not require convoluted instance naming and tracking
5. VM deletion is simple
6. enables better test covergae

The patch makes use of the same VM for resizing.

Methods no longer used have been removed. These methods were
specific to the old resize.

Co-authored-by: Radoslav Gerganov <rgerganov@vmware.com>

Change-Id: Ibcb108c2e0f84a84c599d2e7762a11efc7659395
Closes-bug: #1407438
Closes-bug: #1407050
Closes-bug: #1402784

deleted_lines: def get_vm_resize_spec(client_factory, instance): resize_spec.numCPUs = int(instance['vcpus']) resize_spec.memoryMB = int(instance['memory_mb'])

commit_message:
Add support for LDAP connection pools

LDAP connection pools allow for increased LDAP performance by
maintaining a connection pool. Documentation on configuation is
available here:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/configuration.html

Change-Id: I6376e8ca5fffa7e04774fa1fa81709f7eaae3b4a

commit_message:
Add Puppet 4.x lint checks

This changes the puppet-lint requirement to 1.1.x, so that we can use
puppet-lint plugins.  Most of these plugins are for 4.x compat, but some
just catch common errors.

Change-Id: I3b16baf063746024cb8dc89a931dae2f604258f6

commit_message:
Remove nova v3 regex from devstack-virtual-ironic

Since I5de01deaa699e03b0e838952239011da54702daf , nova v3 api tests
have been removed from Tempest. So the regex of nova v3 api tests are
unnecessary, then this patch removes it.

Change-Id: Ic04829f380da0eb7e3712f34fc0c028c36d17933

commit_message:
Allow symlinks in the container build

This patch permits symlinks in the docker build.  Normally docker
does not permit symlinked files in the build context sent to the
docker server.  To work around this problem, a secure directory
is created in /tmp and the container contents are copied to that
directory.  Any symlinks are turned into their non-symlinked
equivalents.

Change-Id: I38cd5aeed4c73b90449354a0979fc6ddf7891ccb
Implements-blueprint: linked-build
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/19/155519/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TMPDIR=$(mktemp -d /tmp/output.XXXXXXXXXX) cp -H $IMGDIR/* $TMPDIR if ! docker build ${BUILDFLAGS} -t "$FULLIMAGE" $TMPDIR; thenrm -rf $TMPDIR

commit_message:
storage: pass the archive policy in various methods

That allows to limit the number of archive we try to update or delete to
the real list of existing archives in each driver.

We use a new object Metric for that so it's clean and easy to use.

Change-Id: I5cf3c5f5372ecfec4bd49927f5aff36144182b7c

commit_message:
ofagent: Vendor code split

Install networking-ofagent from StackForge, using DevStack's
external plugins mechanism.

The following line needs to be added to the existing local.conf settings:
    enable_plugin networking-ofagent https://git.openstack.org/stackforge/networking-ofagent

Remove neutron_thirdparty/ryu, as Ryu is installed via
networking-ofagent's requirements.

Change-Id: I12287a47eac4689414f70b517ee37fb98b260e60
Partially-implements: blueprint core-vendor-decomposition
Partial-Bug: #1412653

deleted_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Ryu SDN Framework # ----------------- # Used by ofagent. # TODO(yamamoto): Switch to pip_install once the development was settled # Save trace setting RYU3_XTRACE=$(set +o | grep xtrace) set +o xtrace RYU_DIR=$DEST/ryu # Make this function idempotent and avoid cloning same repo many times # with RECLONE=yes _RYU_INSTALLED=${_RYU_INSTALLED:-False} function install_ryu { if [[ "$_RYU_INSTALLED" == "False" ]]; then git_clone $RYU_REPO $RYU_DIR $RYU_BRANCH export PYTHONPATH=$RYU_DIR:$PYTHONPATH pip_install $(cat $RYU_DIR/tools/pip-requires) _RYU_INSTALLED=True fi } # Restore xtrace $RYU3_XTRACE

commit_message:
Fix flavor size checks and unit tests

This fixes the checks that Horizon does to ensure that the flavor a
user has chosen is big enough for the image they've chosen by
comparing the image virtual and on-disk sizes, as well as the
user-settable 'min_disk' image property.

This also fixes the unit tests for that functionality, which were
mostly broken.

Closes-Bug: 1421017
Change-Id: I9c755c33d29886eeb5eedc48ddde7502fd234085

We have to use existing flavors and images here # rather than just inventing our own image inline (e.g., use # an arbitrary image and flavor and do image.min_disk = # flavor.disk + 1) because # _test_launch_form_instance_requirement_error() only uses # (and only *can* use) the image and flavor ID. So this is a # bit tedious, but has the advantage of working. flavor_id = "bbbbbbbb-bbbb-bbbb-bbbb-bbbbbbbbbbbb" image_id = 'd6936c86-7fec-474a-85c5-5e467b371c3c' self._test_launch_form_instance_requirement_error(image_id, flavor_id, test_with_profile) def test_launch_form_instance_requirement_error_virtual_size( self, test_with_profile=False, ): flavor_id = "bbbbbbbb-bbbb-bbbb-bbbb-bbbbbbbbbbbb" image_id = "278905a6-4b52-4d1e-98f9-8c57bb25ba32" self._test_launch_form_instance_requirement_error(image_id, flavor_id, flavor_id = "aaaaaaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaaaaaaaaaa" image_id = "278905a6-4b52-4d1e-98f9-8c57bb25ba32" self._test_launch_form_instance_requirement_error(image_id, flavor_id,

commit_message:
Replace usage of LazyPluggable by stevedore driver

Stevedore lib support lazy loading, so this change replace
LazyPluggable class by stevedore extentions and remove it

Stevedore support usage of driver property since 0.4 release,
some of Openstack projects like glance is already using it.

Change-Id: I7d384a73861e18cac04e07f75abd60df7f183aa2

commit_message:
Add Puppet 4.x lint checks

This changes the puppet-lint requirement to 1.1.x, so that we can use
puppet-lint plugins.  Most of these plugins are for 4.x compat, but some
just catch common errors.

Change-Id: I48838fa11902247101c0473abff65cbb2558f609

commit_message:
[install-guide] do not synchronize Nova DB on openSUSE/SLES

It is not necessary to manually synchronize the Nova DB on
openSUSE/SLES because nova-manage db sync is part of the
init file.

Change-Id: If2dc3593b0352c4b88a071795a73403ffb3d3a35
Partial-Bug: 1422281
Backport: Juno
(cherry picked from commit 13a7b931da15f98d9d212e259cfca9e9cb67f167)

commit_message:
[install-guide] do not synchronize Glance DB on openSUSE/SLES

It is not necessary to manually synchronize the Glance DB on
openSUSE/SLES because glance-manage db sync is part of the
init file.

Partial-Bug: 1422281
Backport: Juno

Change-Id: I178780225e24e7469527c6873facbeb22418080a
(cherry picked from commit d24bd4300dfc8e9095db34238965bff353450644)

commit_message:
Add Puppet 4.x lint checks

This changes the puppet-lint requirement to 1.1.x, so that we can use
puppet-lint plugins.  Most of these plugins are for 4.x compat, but some
just catch common errors.

Change-Id: I44cb4ffbbc8ccd9f310240a4b1eb6fdfdb435831
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/93/156593/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: include ::neutron::params include ::neutron::policy

commit_message:
In-band RAID configuration using agent ramdisk

This spec proposes to implement the newly
proposed RAIDInterface using agent ramdisk.

Change-Id: Id6b9b99cdd277e154882a289aacfac8387518e9e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/03/147803/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================= Inband RAID configuration using agent ramdisk ============================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/inband-raid-configuration This spec proposes to implement RAID configuration interface using Ironic Python Agent. The first driver to make use of this interface will be ``agent_ilo`` driver. Problem description =================== Currently there is no way in Ironic to do RAID configuration for servers using inband mechanism. Proposed change =============== This spec proposes to implement in-band RAID configuration using IPA. It proposes to implement the RAIDInterface as mentioned in the parent spec [1]. The implementation will be named ``AgentRAIDManagement``. The main job of the implementation will be to invoke the corresponding RAID operation methods on agent ramdisk. Interested vendors will implement these methods in Ironic Python Agent using hardware managers. Following are the changes required: * The following methods will be implemented as part of ``AgentRAIDManagement``: + ``create_configuration`` - This will create the RAID configuration on the bare metal node. The following are the steps: - Calls ``zapping.create_raid_configuration`` on the agent ramdisk passing the details of ``raid_info``. .. note:: This is a zap step that requires agent to be booted on the bare metal node before this method is invoked. This is a common problem for all zap steps the use agent and mechanism for this will be introduced as part of Zapping spec [2]. We assume here that ramdisk is booted and heartbeating before this method is invoked. + ``delete_configuration`` - This will delete the RAID configuration on the bare metal node. The following are the steps: - Calls ``zapping.delete_raid_configuration`` on the agent ramdisk. * The results for both the above commands will be polled on subsequent heartbeats from the ramdisk and then ``update_raid_info`` will be called once RAID operation is done. * Agent ramdisk will be enhanced to add two new methods ``zapping.create_raid_configuration`` and ``raid.delete_raid_configuration``. These methods will route the call to hardware manager, so that different hardware vendors can implement their own methods of managing RAID on their hardware. Alternatives ------------ Some bare metal servers do not support out-of-band RAID configuration. They support only inband raid configuration. I don't see any other alternative other than making use of a ramdisk to do this. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. RPC API impact -------------- None. Driver API impact ----------------- None. Nova driver impact ------------------ None. Security impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Scalability impact ------------------ None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- Other hardware vendors developing drivers for OpenStack can use Ironic Python Agent for in-band RAID configuration. They can add their own hardware manager implementing the method and get the RAID configuration done. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- rameshg87 Work Items ---------- * Implement ``AgentRAIDManagement`` * Make changes in Ironic Python Agent to add methods ``zap.create_raid_configuration`` and ``raid.delete_raid_configuration`` which route calls to respective hardware manager. Dependencies ============ * Implement Zapping States - https://review.openstack.org/140826 Testing ======= Unit tests will be added. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== None. Documentation Impact ==================== None. Most of the RAID configuration details in Ironic are covered in the parent spec. If anything is required in addition, respective vendors making use of ``AgentRAIDManagement`` has to document it. References ========== [1] - New driver interface for RAID configuration https://review.openstack.org/135899 [2] - Implement Zapping States - https://review.openstack.org/140826

commit_message:
Remove computenode relationship on service_get

As there is no longer need for providing the computenode when getting a
service, we can remove the dependency

Partially-Implements blueprint detach-service-from-computenode

Change-Id: Iebd3b4dba905ca8754ac6d1da41719a3c44bbbde
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/97/138297/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _service_get(context, service_id, session=None,def service_get(context, service_id, use_slave=False):
deleted_lines: def _service_get(context, service_id, with_compute_node=True, session=None, if with_compute_node: query = query.options(joinedload('compute_node')) def service_get(context, service_id, with_compute_node=False, use_slave=False): with_compute_node=with_compute_node,

subject: Remove nested service from DB API compute_nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-02 09:36:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3195885be06a425a9121c65fd976dfc2820870cd', 'message': 'Remove nested service from DB API compute_nodes

commit_message:
Remove nested service from DB API compute_nodes

Now all the calls to compute nodes are provided by ComputeNode object and
the service nested field is actually directly checking the Service object,
so we no longer need to add the service information in the DB API.
Also removed the no_date_fields option, as it was never in use.

Partially-Implements blueprint detach-service-from-computenode

Change-Id: I856cf1370824310f73292937df5403b9e77600bd

commit_message:
Change tempest BadRequest exc to tempest-lib exc

This commit changes tempest.exceptions.BadRequest to
tempest_lib.exceptions.BadRequest. This is one of the migrating rest
client to tempest-lib works.

Change-Id: I859bd25c07c6344e6455c4010c253cbdf04315b3

Reduce page title duplication in A and S views

Patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/142802 adds a method of
reducing duplication of page title logic, this patch applies that change
to the project access and security views.

commit_message:
Move the pip_install to 'stack' stage

Nothing guarantees that pip is installed in 'pre-install' stage. Much
better to move the pip_install calls to 'stack'

Change-Id: Ibbbe72073bff12f2be5a36d2aae6ec384b9924f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/35/156635/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Backup/Restore feature for Vertica Datastore

1. Refactored config parameters for backup/restore.
2. Refactored code in backup agent.
3. Added backup/restore functionality using impl classes.
4. Unit tests for backup/restore.

Partially Implements: blueprint vertica-db-support

Change-Id: I285c0a072a9d5ce0d9a2089e58ee1f7710ccbca2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/59/95759/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 Globallogic Inc # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # import getpass from trove.guestagent.strategies.restore import base from trove.guestagent.strategies.backup.vertica_impl import HelperMixin from trove.openstack.common import log as logging from trove.common import utils import trove.guestagent.datastore.vertica.service as dbaas from trove.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) VERTICA_CONFIG = dbaas.VERTICA_CONFIG class VerticaBackup(base.RestoreRunner, HelperMixin): """Implementation of Restore Strategy for VerticaBackup.""" __strategy_name__ = 'VerticaBackup' def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): self.appStatus = dbaas.VerticaAppStatus() self.app = dbaas.VerticaApp(self.appStatus) self.restore_location = kwargs.get('restore_location') self.location = kwargs.get('location') self.checksum = kwargs.get('checksum') self.storage = kwargs.get('storage') def __exit__(self, exc_type, exc_value, traceback): """Clean up everything.""" if exc_type is not None: return False if hasattr(self, 'process'): try: self.process.terminate() except OSError: # Already stopped pass utils.raise_if_process_errored(self.process, RestoreError) return True def _run_restore(self): """Restore vertica datastore.""" restore_file = self.restore_location + "/backups.tar" utils.execute_with_timeout("chown", getpass.getuser(), self.restore_location, run_as_root=True, root_helper="sudo") fo = open(restore_file, 'w') stream = self.storage.load(self.location, self.checksum) metadata_dict = self.storage.load_metadata(self.location, self.checksum) app = dbaas.VerticaApp(dbaas.VerticaAppStatus()) app.create_cnf_update_adminpass(metadata_dict['adminpass']) app.update_cnf_with_user_password(VERTICA_CONFIG, 'dbadmin', metadata_dict['rootpass']) content_length = 0 for chunk in stream: fo.write(chunk) content_length += len(chunk) fo.close() utils.execute_with_timeout("chown", "dbadmin:verticadba", self.restore_location, run_as_root=True, root_helper="sudo") out, err = utils.execute("tar", "-xvf", restore_file, "-C", self.restore_location, run_as_root=True, root_helper="sudo") LOG.info(_("after tar -xvf command out \n%s") % out) LOG.info(_("after tar -xvf command err \n%s") % err) self.helper_action(task="restore", location=self.restore_location, metadata=metadata_dict) return content_length def pre_restore(self): """Runs before the restore action.""" self.app.stop_db() def post_restore(self): """Runs after the restore action.""" self.app.start_vertica()

Use remote git path in DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG

The last parameter is not used currently. For consistency use
git://git.openstack.org everywhere.

Change-Id: I69eca188e538524b276c8adee008f225f6b36381

commit_message:
Initial support for Vertica Datastore in trove

Implemented:

1. CRUD operations on vertica DB using trove APIs.
2. User/Schema operations using Vertica Extensions.
3. Refactored extensions code to load datastore
   specific Extensions. Changes fully compatible to
   all implemented datastores.
4. Ignore Users are now per datastore config options.
5. Datastore-specific models are now better abstracted.
6. Unit tests to all methods for vertica.
7. Default Charset/Default Collation constants
   introduced to better abstract functional tests on
   different datastores.
8. Translations will be added after implementation of
   all functional parts of the BP.

Change-Id: Ib1a4933795f233f5f88a8564e319a6b648ca5274
Implements: blueprint vertica-db-support

commit_message:
Updates samples responses to API calls

According to bug 1370477 the sample responses provided lack the
"roles", "links", "next", "previous" and "self" keys. They are
added in in this commit.

Change-Id: I62b285f748c7796944ba5307db4d0905c5fd63c0
Closes-Bug: #1370477

commit_message:
Stack resources table improvement

In spite of the fact that status of stack resource is "Create complete",
the row color remains yellow instead of grey. This patch set keeps the
column for detailed states and adds a new hidden column for correct
states displaying.

Closes-Bug: #1385244

Change-Id: I2a9e5a6f456378dcd1f96d96f69fdba1527e4f25

commit_message:
Add missing stubs to project stacks tests

test_check_stack, test_suspend_stack and test_resume_stack all had
missing stubs for api.heat, causing weird logs in the tests, as well as
not testing the actions correctly as it would fail before reaching the
action code.

Change-Id: I6aeb2d2c1b6af9222e8ec3691b876051c638e3de
Partial-Bug: 1407981

commit_message:
Don't pass the port down to the floating ip processing

This is justified by the Law of Demeter.  I ran in to this while
trying to refactor the floating ip processing here [1].  The scope of
that patch can be reduced significantly with this refactor.  Also, it
helps us to decouple the floating ip NAT processing from the details
of the port which is a long-term goal.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/142863/

Change-Id: I606dfd43977934f1accea60911e10e71c1cbba73
Partially-Implements: bp/restructure-l3-agent

commit_message:
Support Manila pools in NetApp Clustered Data ONTAP driver

The Cinder pools feature is being ported to Manila, and drivers must be
updated to report pools in order to use this feature.  This patch adds
support for pools to the NetApp Clustered Data ONTAP driver for Manila.

Implements blueprint support-pools-in-netapp-cdot-driver

Change-Id: Iba327a745227e6219e6e1fc77af407f097905d8f

commit_message:
Allow adding to INSTALLED_APPS from local_settings.py

Defines a new option, ADD_INSTALLED_APPS, which gets prepended
to the beginning of INSTALLED_APPS.

Change-Id: I956835c3e18edee9e223a607005b47a5c5977687
Closes-bug: #1343342

commit_message:
Reduce title duplication in project networking

Patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/142802 adds a method of
reducing duplication of page title logic, this patch applies that change
to the project network topology, networks and routers views.

Change-Id: I2a1372eb9d82acb3d9a259e19a3ecfb8aeff4c02
Partial-Bug: 1413749

commit_message:
Adds support for user created f5 prefix names and route domains

Added the ability for the user of the f5 config script to override
the default prefix of RPC. This is needed when multiple labs are
running on the same f5.

Added the ability for the user of the f5 config script to use route
domains on their f5. This is used for multiple labs using the same
f5 LB

Change-Id: I0eba42cf3cb2419818d31c9ad2593a529fc375dc
Closes-Bug: #1415994

commit_message:
Fix serialization of datetime objects

json.dumps needs a custom default function to handle the
case of serializing a datetime object with an embedded Utc
object.  This CR adds a generic method to allow anyone
needed to perform such special processing to include it
all in one place.

Change-Id: I84a31e38bf97d83a62108d8cb8f0466ed7fc7d03
Closes-Bug: 1420442

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-10 14:38:39.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/inventory/dynamic_inventory.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/de32ddca574150806c4dbb9a47930b0b6d1196f0', 'message': 'Remove ImportError handling in dynamic_inventory

The import of netaddr any yaml is done within a try/except block. If an
ImportError occurs an error message is printed and the script ignores
it. Ansible does not display the printed message and the script will
still fail, just later on.

This commit removes the exception handling so that if there is an
ImportError the script will fail straight away.

Change-Id: Iff935db62bde954ac4ff0b920409c18dd494bdff
Closes-Bug: #1420312
'}]
commit_message:
Remove ImportError handling in dynamic_inventory

The import of netaddr any yaml is done within a try/except block. If an
ImportError occurs an error message is printed and the script ignores
it. Ansible does not display the printed message and the script will
still fail, just later on.

This commit removes the exception handling so that if there is an
ImportError the script will fail straight away.

Change-Id: Iff935db62bde954ac4ff0b920409c18dd494bdff
Closes-Bug: #1420312
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/98/154498/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import netaddrimport yaml
deleted_lines: try: import yaml except ImportError: print('Missing Dependency, "PyYAML"') try: import netaddr except ImportError: print('Missing Dependency, "netaddr"')

commit_message:
Designate root user to run the Tempest playbook.

This allows non-root users using Ansible to reach the correct
authorized_keys file within containers.

Change-Id: I35a60b2fc937e839e7cd7fcc7da8649c4b3de440
Closes-Bug: 1418122

commit_message:
Image data remains in backend for deleted image

Trying to delete image created using task api (import-from) image gets
deleted from the database, but image data remains in the backend. Import
task does not update the location of the image and it remains None even
image becomes active. Location entry is not added in the database in
image_locations table.

Added location information to the image before saving the image in
the database.

SecurityImpact

Conflicts:
	glance/common/scripts/image_import/main.py

Change-Id: Ie389de6538a9b98dc51c7d781b81b3ab10b83842
Closes-Bug: #1420696
(cherry picked from commit 78b5b0a9575cd5e9c4543ec0e8fd6072af1f0ebb)

commit_message:
Setup br-tun in secure fail mode to avoid broadcast storms

When not creating br-tun in secure fail mode, there are chances to
get a broadcast storm from br-tun.

For example, this occurs when at least three nodes have the br-tun
OpenFlow rules reset in and a broadcast/multicast packet enters br-tun.

This can happen if:
  * openvswitch is restarted, until the agent reloads the Openflow rules.
  * during neutron-openvswitch-agent restart, br-tun is reset, and there
is a few seconds timeframe where tunnel endpoints are plugged and OF
rules are reset.

Secure fail mode doesn't forward traffic by default if no rule is hit.

Change-Id: Iba5ded14179156decb16dcd4b898c026660f9653
Closes-bug: #1421232
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/28/155328/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.tun_br.reset_bridge(secure_mode=True)

commit_message:
Sync oslo-incubator and remove log module

Sync to oslo-incubator at 0314366, and remove the (now removed)
log.py - this has graduated to oslo_log, which heat now uses.

commit_message:
Remove RPC dependency to create FIP agent gw port

The Floatingip Agent Gateway port was initially
created when the agent requests one through an
RPC exchange.

We are seeing more failures in this area of the
code where there is delay in getting the agent
gateway port from the plugin through RPC.

Change-Id: Ieaa79c8bf2b1e03bc352f9252ce22286703e3715
Related-bug: #1415522

commit_message:
Change disk serial to re-use volume UUID

Disk devices need the serial defined in the domain xml. Instead of
generating one randomly, we can simply reuse the volume's UUID that
already existed.

Change-Id: Iabb8805e8cc1ef7528e0853093d3ba990444feb1
Closes-bug: #1412443

subject: Fix rabbit driver use of ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-29 15:30:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/b8b80a04b0b379c75748bd4d32475df880dc6dbb', 'message': "Remove the use of PROTOCOL_SSLv3

The PROTOCOL_SSLv3 should not be used, as it can be exploited with
a protocol downgrade attack. Also, its support has been removed in
Debian, so it simply doesn't work at all now in Sid.

This patch removes PROTOCOL_SSLv3 from one of the possible protocols
used by oslo.messaging.

Closes-Bug: #1395095
Change-Id: I2c1977c3bfc1923bcb03744e909f2e70c7fdb14c
(cherry picked from commit 42f55a1dda96d4ceecf8cca5fba9cd723673f6e3)
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-15 15:45:54.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/42b65bfd690193145d53e640f11ade6b057083e5', 'message': 'Fix rabbit driver use of ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3

The rabbit driver required that ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 is defined, but
not all Python implementations define it.

The code was changed so that the "sslv3" value is only allowed for
the "kombu_ssl_version" version if ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 is defined in
the Python standard library.

The title of the commit in master was:

 Remove the use of PROTOCOL_SSLv3

but this was changed since it didn't describe the actual change.

Closes-Bug: #1395095
Change-Id: I2c1977c3bfc1923bcb03744e909f2e70c7fdb14c
(cherry picked from commit 42f55a1dda96d4ceecf8cca5fba9cd723673f6e3)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbit driver use of ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3

The rabbit driver required that ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 is defined, but
not all Python implementations define it.

The code was changed so that the "sslv3" value is only allowed for
the "kombu_ssl_version" version if ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 is defined in
the Python standard library.

The title of the commit in master was:

 Remove the use of PROTOCOL_SSLv3

but this was changed since it didn't describe the actual change.

Closes-Bug: #1395095
Change-Id: I2c1977c3bfc1923bcb03744e909f2e70c7fdb14c
(cherry picked from commit 42f55a1dda96d4ceecf8cca5fba9cd723673f6e3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/13/137913/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'valid values are TLSv1 and SSLv23. SSLv2 and ' 'SSLv3 may be available on some distributions.' "sslv23": ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv23 try: _SSL_PROTOCOLS["sslv3"] = ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 except AttributeError: pass
deleted_lines: 'valid values are TLSv1, SSLv23 and SSLv3. SSLv2 may ' 'be available on some distributions.' "sslv23": ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv23, "sslv3": ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3

subject: Fix nailgun and cobbler containers build failure.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-10 07:57:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/479d09b7e28c0bd08349888906006bd7720ec2f3', 'message': "Fix nailgun and cobbler containers build failure.

Recently a new package fence-agents-all (version 4.0.7) has been added
to the OSCI yum repo. This package provides and obsoletes fence-agents
version <= 3.1.13. Due to a poor integration of puppet with package
management tools installing fence-agents with puppet fails:

Debug: Package[fence-agents](provider=yum): Ensuring => latest
Debug: Executing '/usr/bin/yum -d 0 -e 0 -y install fence-agents'
Debug: Executing '/bin/rpm -q fence-agents --nosignature --nodigest --qf %{NAME} %|EPOCH?{%{EPOCH}}:{0}| %{VERSION} %{RELEASE} %{ARCH} :DESC: %%{SUMMARY}\n'
Error: Could not update: Could not find package fence-agents

puppet does not try to figure out if fence-agents is provided by some
other package and query the status of that package, hence the error.
As a work around update the manifests to require fence-agents-all package.
A proper way to solve the problem is to fix dependencies of the packages
(if cobbler needs fence-agents it should depend on it so yum picks a proper
version of fence-agents without any tricks in manifests).

Closes-Bug: #1419889
Change-Id: I208e187def737d05d033e95f34ae5ca58ece9bd0
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-14 15:38:34.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nailgun/manifests/packages.pp', 'deployment/puppet/cobbler/manifests/packages.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/d8f82bbee2ac159134e73a5725a30d3dbf0fd553', 'message': "Fix nailgun and cobbler containers build failure.

Recently a new package fence-agents-all (version 4.0.7) has been added
to the OSCI yum repo. This package provides and obsoletes fence-agents
version <= 3.1.13. Due to a poor integration of puppet with package
management tools installing fence-agents with puppet fails:

Debug: Package[fence-agents](provider=yum): Ensuring => latest
Debug: Executing '/usr/bin/yum -d 0 -e 0 -y install fence-agents'
Debug: Executing '/bin/rpm -q fence-agents --nosignature --nodigest --qf %{NAME} %|EPOCH?{%{EPOCH}}:{0}| %{VERSION} %{RELEASE} %{ARCH} :DESC: %%{SUMMARY}\n'
Error: Could not update: Could not find package fence-agents

puppet does not try to figure out if fence-agents is provided by some
other package and query the status of that package, hence the error.
As a work around update the manifests to require fence-agents-all package.
A proper way to solve the problem is to fix dependencies of the packages
(if cobbler needs fence-agents it should depend on it so yum picks a proper
version of fence-agents without any tricks in manifests).

Closes-Bug: #1419889
Change-Id: I208e187def737d05d033e95f34ae5ca58ece9bd0
"}]
commit_message:
Fix nailgun and cobbler containers build failure.

Recently a new package fence-agents-all (version 4.0.7) has been added
to the OSCI yum repo. This package provides and obsoletes fence-agents
version <= 3.1.13. Due to a poor integration of puppet with package
management tools installing fence-agents with puppet fails:

Debug: Package[fence-agents](provider=yum): Ensuring => latest
Debug: Executing '/usr/bin/yum -d 0 -e 0 -y install fence-agents'
Debug: Executing '/bin/rpm -q fence-agents --nosignature --nodigest --qf %{NAME} %|EPOCH?{%{EPOCH}}:{0}| %{VERSION} %{RELEASE} %{ARCH} :DESC: %%{SUMMARY}\n'
Error: Could not update: Could not find package fence-agents

puppet does not try to figure out if fence-agents is provided by some
other package and query the status of that package, hence the error.
As a work around update the manifests to require fence-agents-all package.
A proper way to solve the problem is to fix dependencies of the packages
(if cobbler needs fence-agents it should depend on it so yum picks a proper
version of fence-agents without any tricks in manifests).

Closes-Bug: #1419889
Change-Id: I208e187def737d05d033e95f34ae5ca58ece9bd0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/71/154371/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add horizon.cookies.getRaw to access raw cookie values
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-16 07:56:44.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/horizon/js/angular/horizon.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/fb8cd9704b08b99e5a3ae4c5f03e7704b4be79bb', 'message': "Add horizon.cookies.getRaw to access raw cookie values

Since porting to ngCookie's $cookieStore, horizon.cookies supports
values of type object. In order to implement this, all values are
stored in their JSON representations. This however removes the ability
to read values set by the backend, since horizon.cookies.get attempts
to deserialize the cookie value assuming it is stored in JSON.

This change implements an additional utility method to access raw
cookie values instead of modifying horizon.get to be more adaptive
to non-JSON values, because that would mean the statement
horizon.put('keyBackend', horizon.get('keyBackend')) yields unequal
before and after values when accessing cookies set by the backend.
Moreover, horizon.cookies.getRaw helps developers to be more mindful
of accessing cookie values set outside of the Horizon frontend.

Change-Id: I21cd641b5495f57492a210ce88228f3e8783b86f
Closes-Bug: #1358911
"}]
commit_message:
Add horizon.cookies.getRaw to access raw cookie values

Since porting to ngCookie's $cookieStore, horizon.cookies supports
values of type object. In order to implement this, all values are
stored in their JSON representations. This however removes the ability
to read values set by the backend, since horizon.cookies.get attempts
to deserialize the cookie value assuming it is stored in JSON.

This change implements an additional utility method to access raw
cookie values instead of modifying horizon.get to be more adaptive
to non-JSON values, because that would mean the statement
horizon.put('keyBackend', horizon.get('keyBackend')) yields unequal
before and after values when accessing cookies set by the backend.
Moreover, horizon.cookies.getRaw helps developers to be more mindful
of accessing cookie values set outside of the Horizon frontend.

Change-Id: I21cd641b5495f57492a210ce88228f3e8783b86f
Closes-Bug: #1358911
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/46/156146/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: horizon.cookies.getRaw = function (key) { return $cookies[key]; };

commit_message:
network: Fix another IPv6 test for Mac

Commit 713767660ba44421ea5e0406d121ea868ad178ac skipped some tests on a Mac
that would fail because OSX doesn't stringify IPv6 addresses properly.

This test was missed, so adding it now.

Change-Id: I413e2dae75e2144132db468f3e0c81229e3bf45a
Related-Bug: 1409135
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/14/156414/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.tests.unit import utils as test_utils @testtools.skipIf(test_utils.is_osx(), 'IPv6 pretty-printing broken on OSX, see bug 1409135')

commit_message:
Add dhcp check to fuelmenu save-only mode

This will print an error message to the console
when fuelmenu --save-only is run. It will help
in debugging issues so that the error is more
prominent in logs.

Change-Id: Ib83b01458177772b1fd2e2c1a38a6527d47e78b3
Closes-Bug: #1358884

added_lines: from common import timeout import dhcp_checker.api import dhcp_checker.utilsimport traceback try: dhcptimeout = 5 default = [] with timeout.run_with_timeout(dhcp_checker.utils.IfaceState, [iface], timeout=dhcptimeout) as iface: dhcp_server_data = timeout.run_with_timeout( dhcp_checker.api.check_dhcp_on_eth, [iface, dhcptimeout], timeout=dhcptimeout, default=default) except (KeyboardInterrupt, timeout.TimeoutError): log.debug("DHCP scan timed out") log.warning(traceback.format_exc()) dhcp_server_data = default num_dhcp = len(dhcp_server_data) if num_dhcp == 0: log.debug("No DHCP servers found") else: #Problem exists, but permit user to continue log.error("%s foreign DHCP server(s) found: %s" % (num_dhcp, dhcp_server_data)) print("ERROR: %s foreign DHCP server(s) found: %s" % (num_dhcp, dhcp_server_data))

commit_message:
Add get_current_env() to fix the decorator download_astute_yaml

@download_astute_yaml fails if wrong class is decorated:
 AttributeError: 'FuelWebClient' object has no attribute 'env'

Move class detection to the separate method and use it.

Related-bug: #1401601
Change-Id: Ie3f3d5e2bc89c7e021b6c0ddc48503e2e4d6140f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/01/153201/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_current_env(args): if args[0].__class__.__name__ == "EnvironmentModel": return args[0] elif args[0].__class__.__name__ == "FuelWebClient": return args[0].environment else: logger.warning("Unexpected class!")

commit_message:
Libvirt: Support for generic vhostuser vif.

This commit implements support for generic vhostuser vif.

Change-Id: I827aa45698ff53418725a112acdc42dfacbc1c61
Blueprint: libvirt-vif-vhost-user
Co-Authored-By: Luke Gorrie <luke@snabb.co>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/09/149309/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def set_vif_host_backend_vhostuser_config(conf, mode, path): """Populate a LibvirtConfigGuestInterface instance with host backend details for vhostuser socket. """ conf.net_type = "vhostuser" conf.vhostuser_type = "unix" conf.vhostuser_mode = mode conf.vhostuser_path = path

commit_message:
Add devstack plugin

The /devstack directory adds a script to build midonet from devstack.
It is a passthrough sourced script that builds the plugin, clones
midonet repo and sets libvirt options.

Change-Id: I95008ac972afc9bb267f7c9f2cdb0d77f99ea4d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/05/156505/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # MidoNet repo MIDONET_REPO=${MIDONET_REPO:-http://github.com/midonet/midonet.git} MIDONET_BRANCH=${MIDONET_BRANCH:-master} MIDONET_DIR=${MIDONET_DIR:-$DEST/midonet} # MidoNet service endpoint configuration MIDONET_API_PORT=${MIDONET_API_PORT:-8081} MIDONET_SERVICE_PROTOCOL=${MIDONET_SERVICE_PROTOCOL:-$SERVICE_PROTOCOL} MIDONET_SERVICE_HOST=${MIDONET_SERVICE_HOST:-$SERVICE_HOST} MIDONET_API_URL="${MIDONET_SERVICE_PROTOCOL}://${MIDONET_SERVICE_HOST}:${MIDONET_API_PORT}/midonet-api"

commit_message:
Prepare the project for openstack gates

Changes:
* .gitreview pointing to openstack gerrit
* tests passing for new plugin namespace
* setup.cfg instead of setup.py for the use of pbr

Change-Id: Ia2e22fa0035bce47586351d0dc6f9486fd56f7d2

commit_message:
[wip] enable tempest scenarios for aio

This patch updates the tempest resources play to create all the
pre-requistes for running the commit_aio tempest tests.  This is
currently test_minimum_basic and test_swift_basic_ops.

Also defaults gate-check-commit RUN_TEMPEST and DEPLOY_TEMPEST variables
to yes.

The option to specify an endpoint type for Tempest is also added.

Closes-Bug: #1419094
Change-Id: Ib92b30f040cf05202d7785c8a3132150d31ef92e

commit_message:
libvirt: Use XPath instead of loop in _get_interfaces

etree supports XPath to find specific node, so we don't need
find the node with comparing its tag and attribute. This commit
uses Xpath in method _get_interfaces.

Change-Id: I5db1c063511abe3e53ab6b4da8e89ab8e3f8e18a
Partial-Bug: #1407915
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/26/153226/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nodes = doc.findall('./devices/interface/target') for target in nodes: interfaces.append(target.get('dev'))
deleted_lines: ret = doc.findall('./devices/interface') for node in ret: devdst = None for child in list(node): if child.tag == 'target': devdst = child.attrib['dev'] if devdst is None: continue interfaces.append(devdst)

commit_message:
fuel_upgrade: add retries for getting token

After starting a new Keystone container, the first attempt to get a token
fails. Unfortunately, the logs keep silent and say nothing. As a workaround,
we can just increase retries number.

Change-Id: Ib1bba120614d1964e838c289489f1877074c324d
Closes-Bug: #1403798

commit_message:
Handle SPBM SecurityError

SPBM APIs throw SecurityError on session expiry. Currently
it is unhandled which could result in session reconnection
failure. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Ibbd534464c73cc8afc30ba6ff29b46f9287a83c6

commit_message:
Adds missing files

Under certain circonstances which I couldn't fully understand
(eg: it works if in a git repo, but not if the .git folder
isn't there), python setup.py install forgets some files, and
not all is there. This patch fixed all issues for me in my
Debian package.

Change-Id: I814c4e91156434b1897eb9f50af4d0b81543ca2b

commit_message:
PBM utility method to retrieve profiles of a VM

Add method 'get_profiles' in pbm module to retrieve SPBM
storage profiles associated with a VM.

Change-Id: I1c96fc87ae5a24c470a67786bac5197f23c0f288
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/45/155745/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_profiles(session, vm): """Query storage profiles associated with the given vm. :param session: VMwareAPISession instance :param vm: vm reference :return: profile IDs """ pbm = session.pbm profile_manager = pbm.service_content.profileManager object_ref = pbm.client.factory.create('ns0:PbmServerObjectRef') object_ref.key = vm.value object_ref.objectType = 'virtualMachine' return session.invoke_api(pbm, 'PbmQueryAssociatedProfile', profile_manager, entity=object_ref)

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pycadf refs/changes/33/156333/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pyCADF's version of the audit middleware has been deprecated as of pyCADF 0.8.0. For continued support, the middleware is now maintained under the Identity (Keystone) umbrella. Related documentation can be found here_. .. _here: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystonemiddleware/audit.html
deleted_lines: The pyCADF library provides an optional WSGI middleware filter which allows the ability to audit api requests for each component of OpenStack. The audit middleware filter utilises environment variables to build the CADF event. .. figure:: ./images/middleware.png :figwidth: 100% :align: center :alt: Figure 1: Audit middleware in Nova pipeline The figure above shows the middleware in Nova's pipeline. Enabling audit middleware ========================= To enable the audit middleware, the following requirements need to be satisfied: 1. pyCADF library must be added to the requirements file of the project to be audited. 2. The project should utilise oslo.messaging_ notification system. .. note:: If the project utilises oslo's `old notification system`_, a compatible middleware can be synced from oslo-incubator's `middleware code base`_. If the above requirements are satisfied, auditing can be enabled by editing the project's api-paste.ini file to include the following filter definition: :: [filter:audit] paste.filter_factory = pycadf.middleware.audit:AuditMiddleware.factory or :: [filter:audit] paste.filter_factory = <project>.openstack.common.middleware.audit:AuditMiddleware.factory The filter should be included after Keystone's auth_token middleware so it can utilise environment variables set by Keystone's middleware. Below is an example using Nova's WSGI pipeline:: [composite:openstack_compute_api_v2] use = call:nova.api.auth:pipeline_factory noauth = faultwrap sizelimit noauth ratelimit osapi_compute_app_v2 keystone = faultwrap sizelimit authtoken keystonecontext ratelimit audit osapi_compute_app_v2 keystone_nolimit = faultwrap sizelimit authtoken keystonecontext audit osapi_compute_app_v2 .. _oslo.messaging: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging .. _old notification system: https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator .. _middleware code base: https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator/tree/master/openstack/common/middleware Configure audit middleware ========================== To properly audit api requests, the audit middleware requires an api_audit_map.conf to be defined. The project's corresponding api_audit_map.conf file is included in the `pyCADF library`_. By default, the audit middleware filter expects the map file to be located in the same folder as the other conf files related to the project (ie.'/etc/<project>' folder). This default functionality is to be deprecated and so the location should be specified explicitly by adding the path to the 'audit_map_file' option of the filter definition:: [filter:audit] paste.filter_factory = pycadf.middleware.audit:AuditMiddleware.factory audit_map_file = /etc/nova/api_audit_map.conf Additional options can be set:: [filter:audit] paste.filter_factory = pycadf.middleware.audit:AuditMiddleware.factory audit_map_file = /etc/nova/api_audit_map.conf service_name = test # opt to set HTTP_X_SERVICE_NAME environ variable ignore_req_list = GET,POST # opt to ignore specific requests .. _pyCADF library: https://github.com/openstack/pycadf/tree/master/etc/pycadf

commit_message:
Rename utils -> _utils

Hide the utils module, which should not be part of the public API.
utils.py contains functions required internally (moved from Nova).

Change-Id: I3666d35d28592bd49768424049142e5d353a916d
Closes-Bug: 1417284

commit_message:
Add support for updating a bay

Users can use these commands to add/remove/update bay attribute(s):
magnum bay-update <bay_id> replace <path=value>
magnum bay-update <bay_id> add <path=value>
magnum bay-update <bay_id> remove <path=value>

For example, this command updates the node_count attribute of a bay:
magnum bay-update 0aab40ba-3f48-4e6e-88a6-247be18b9711 replace node_count=1

Change-Id: If003beaca8e7e8bbdff2cf24d2810b0db9efdf41
Implements: blueprint update-node-count

commit_message:
Use plugin ids instead of versions to enable/disable plugin

With plugins patching feature we cannot rely on
plugin version and plugin name to find the correct
plugin, because version can be changed after minor
plugin update, e.g. 1.0.0 -> 1.0.1.

Add migrations to replace plugin versions with
plugin ids. And use new code to enable/disable
plugins.

Change-Id: I44b04893a3b061fa31ce7612f8172ed0a58b1acd
Implements: blueprint plugins-security-fixes-delivery

added_lines: import six from nailgun.logger import logger from nailgun.objects.plugin import Plugin from nailgun.objects.plugin import PluginCollection def process_cluster_attributes(cls, cluster, attrs): """Iterates through plugins attributes, creates or deletes Cluster <-> Plugins relation if plugin is enabled or disabled. :param cluster: Cluster object :param attrs: dictionary with cluster attributes """ for key, attr in six.iteritems(attrs): cls._process_attr(cluster, attr) @classmethod def _process_attr(cls, cluster, attr): if not isinstance(attr, dict): return metadata = attr.get('metadata', {}) plugin_id = metadata.get('plugin_id') if not plugin_id: return plugin = Plugin.get_by_uid(plugin_id) if not plugin: logger.warning('Plugin with id "%s" is not found, skip it', plugin_id) return enabled = metadata.get('enabled', False) # Value is true and plugin is not enabled for this cluster # that means plugin was enabled on this request if enabled and cluster not in plugin.clusters: plugin.clusters.append(cluster) # Value is false and plugin is enabled for this cluster # that means plugin was disabled on this request elif not enabled and cluster in plugin.clusters: plugin.clusters.remove(cluster)
deleted_lines: from nailgun.objects.plugin import PluginCollection def process_cluster_attributes(cls, cluster, attrs, query=None): if query is None: query = PluginCollection.all() for plugin_db in query: attr_plugin = ClusterAttributesPlugin(plugin_db) attr_plugin.process_cluster_attributes(cluster, attrs)

commit_message:
Finish cleanup CONF from auth

KeystoneV3Credentials use configuration to pass add domain information if
missing. In preparation for migration to tempest-lib, remove that logic,
and move it to get_credentials in cred_provider.

Change-Id: I3adee2c047d63af55597e42c5a299dfa2c49001a

This reverts commit ca8df08bb8ed03981b7a0f9d6fedb3418b061804.

The reverted commit introduced a regression that all firewall
related resources from all projects are shown in the project panel
if a user has admin role. It violates the design policy of the
Project dashboard (which focuses on project-related resources).
A fix for the original bug 1294541 is coming in the subsequent patch.

Closes-Bug: #1422081
Related-Bug: #1294541
Change-Id: Ie8864b92b4ffb59681c0d18ac8b5f09f636d5fba

commit_message:
Revert "Fix shared firewall policy can not be displayed in horizon"

This reverts commit ca8df08bb8ed03981b7a0f9d6fedb3418b061804.

The reverted commit introduced a regression that all firewall
related resources from all projects are shown in the project panel
if a user has admin role. It violates the design policy of the
Project dashboard (which focuses on project-related resources).
A fix for the original bug 1294541 is coming in the subsequent patch.

Closes-Bug: #1422081
Related-Bug: #1294541
Change-Id: Ie8864b92b4ffb59681c0d18ac8b5f09f636d5fba

commit_message:
Move logging to use oslo_log library

The oslo-incubator log modlule has been removed, so port to the oslo_log
library.  Note this uses the new (non namespaced, e.g oslo.log) import
convention, we'll need to align other imports in a future commit.

Some import reordering was required due to pedantic H30[57] checks, and
the services have all been converted to initialize the oslo_log library
as this is done differently to the log.py in incubator.

Change-Id: Ib5a97123fe1b287bc531e42d7887c13ba6205628
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/23/156323/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import log as logging
deleted_lines: from heat.openstack.common import log as logging

Trying to delete image created using task api (import-from) image gets

image becomes active. Location entry is not added in the database in
image_locations table.

commit_message:
Image data remains in backend for deleted image

Trying to delete image created using task api (import-from) image gets
deleted from the database, but image data remains in the backend. Import
task does not update the location of the image and it remains None even
image becomes active. Location entry is not added in the database in
image_locations table.

Added location information to the image before saving the image in
the database.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ie389de6538a9b98dc51c7d781b81b3ab10b83842
Closes-Bug: #1420696
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/93/156493/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Split resource_setup for orchestration tests

Split up the resource_setup method for all the orchestration tests, as per the
latest spec.

Partially-implements bp:resource-cleanup

commit_message:
Use newer kernel-lt for master node

Newer kernel significantly improves Docker
performance, especially when loading and
starting new containers.

Change-Id: Ia27daba30382e0020c6ed50de3e7cefb98a351cc
Closes-Bug: #1322641

commit_message:
Use FuelClientSettings everywhere

This patch moves all default settings from the code
to the default single settings file. And modifies
recently introduced settings manager to be able to
also update default values from /etc/fuel/client/config.yaml
file and from environment varables

DocImpact
Blueprint: re-thinking-fuel-client
Change-Id: Ib73b0494cf30e75099aa7a0552745cd4adc3a07e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-fuelclient refs/changes/63/151263/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from fuelclient import fuelclient_settings conf = fuelclient_settings.get_settings() self.root = "http://{server}:{port}".format(server=conf.SERVER_ADDRESS, port=conf.LISTEN_PORT) self.keystone_base = self.root + "/keystone/v2.0" self.user = conf.KEYSTONE_USER self.password = conf.KEYSTONE_PASS
deleted_lines: import os path_to_config = "/etc/fuel/client/config.yaml" defaults = { "SERVER_ADDRESS": "127.0.0.1", "LISTEN_PORT": "8000", "KEYSTONE_USER": "admin", "KEYSTONE_PASS": "admin", } if os.access(path_to_config, os.R_OK): with open(path_to_config, "r") as fh: config = yaml.load(fh.read()) defaults.update(config) defaults.update(os.environ) self.root = "http://{SERVER_ADDRESS}:{LISTEN_PORT}".format(**defaults) self.keystone_base = ( "http://{SERVER_ADDRESS}:{LISTEN_PORT}/keystone/v2.0" .format(**defaults) ) self.user = defaults["KEYSTONE_USER"] self.password = defaults["KEYSTONE_PASS"]

subject: Quiesce boot from volume instances during live snapshot
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-03 17:31:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1adc25e2d9f0d85888874871fcac5602bdd61670', 'message': "Quiesce boot from volume instances during live snapshot

With this patch, if boot from volume instances is active and the boot
volume has 'hw_require_quiesce=yes' image metadata, nova will
automatically quiesce the instances on creating volume snapshots
by image-create or backup.

To utilize this feature in KVM instances, qemu-guest-agent must be
installed in the guest and the image metadata must have
'hw_qemu_guest_agent=yes' property.

Change-Id: Ic43dfa441fad8fefaa41b1db43ad19b15dc483c3

commit_message:
Quiesce boot from volume instances during live snapshot

With this patch, nova will automatically quiesce active volume boot
instances on creating volume snapshots by image-create command.
After volume snapshots are completed, the instance is unquiesced.

if the boot volume has 'os_require_quiesce=yes' image metadata,
the snapshotting is aborted when quiescing fails. Otherwise,
quiescing is skipped and the snapshotting is continued.

To utilize this feature in KVM instances, qemu-guest-agent must be
installed in the guest and the image metadata must have
'hw_qemu_guest_agent=yes' property.

Change-Id: Ic43dfa441fad8fefaa41b1db43ad19b15dc483c3
Implements: blueprint quiesced-image-snapshots-with-qemu-guest-agent

subject: Remove the import of oslo_i18n lib in Juno
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-11 05:00:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/300a3cc9fccdc9bfae71c962fb941b6a5058167e', 'message': "Remove the import of oslo.i18n lib in Juno

We had a bug in Cinder where somebody submitted unit
test code that accessed a private method in the oslo.i18n
lib.  Obviously this was wrong, and when the lib was updated
and that private method went away we started getting all sorts
of failures.

Initially a fix was proposed that removed this change and all was
well.  However, that proposed patch was modified by another
individual that introduced the addition of a new oslo.i18n fixture
to toggle lazy translations.  This was probably fine for Master,
HOWEVER that patch was then back ported to Juno, which was completely
inappropriate as Juno was not using the oslo.i18n lib but using
openstack/common/gettextutils.

This patch modifies the change that was submitted and removes the
import of the oslo.i18n lib which should have never been introduced
in stable in the first place.

Before somebody proposes it, leaving the lib dependency and capping
it is NOT the right answer here.  The lib should absolutely not be
introduced/back-ported in to stable.  Especially in this case where
it simply is used for a unit test that quite frankly is a crap test
that shouldn't be there to begin with.

Change-Id: I5776d9f54d7a85d74311d9b8dbbe28fb81c62027
Closes-Bug: #1420335

This patch modifies the change that was submitted and removes the

commit_message:
Remove the import of oslo_i18n lib in Juno

To address bug 1408099 I submitted a patch that
removed the calls to the private method in the i18n
code (change I2ae3d9b98c107cebaf386adbdcdb3cfafee070be).

Unfortunately as can be seen in the patch review,
my work was modified by another contributor and an update
of the oslo_18n lib which included a test fixture to togle
lazy translations was added.

This was probably fine for Master, HOWEVER that patch was
then back ported to Juno, which was completely inappropriate
as Juno was not using the oslo_i18n lib but using
openstack/common/gettextutils (change 894f20d).

This patch modifies the change that was submitted and removes the
import of the oslo_i18n lib which should have never been introduced
in stable in the first place.

Before somebody proposes it, leaving the lib dependency and capping
it is NOT the right answer here.  The lib should absolutely not be
introduced/back-ported in to stable.  Especially in this case where
it simply is used for a unit test that quite frankly is a crap test
that shouldn't be there to begin with.  There is no reason I can see
at all why we are testing translations in Cinder unit tests, that
should be left to the unit test for the library itself.

Change-Id: I5776d9f54d7a85d74311d9b8dbbe28fb81c62027
Closes-Bug: #1420335

commit_message:
Fixes total_capacity_gb value in CloudByte driver.

CloudByte storage returns total capacity value in two formats. One is
numeric and the other is alphanumeric.

Previously data['total_capacity_gb'] was referring the alphanumeric value
& now it is referring to the correct numeric value.

In addition, changes were made to test_cloudbyte.py to unit test
free_capacity_gb and total_capacity_gb.

Closes-Bug: 1420746
