commit_message:
Test "Add murano benchmarks" vs mos

Change-Id: I59bdaaa5d55eae9259d2740ab43b2cbbd8c9c6f1
Co-Authored-By: Roman Vasilets <rvasilets@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Murashov <smurashov@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/24/156524/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014: Mirantis Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from oslotest import mockpatch from rally.benchmark.scenarios.murano import utils from rally import exceptions as rally_exceptions from tests.unit import test BM_UTILS = "rally.benchmark.utils" MRN_UTILS = "rally.benchmark.scenarios.murano.utils" class MuranoScenarioTestCase(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(MuranoScenarioTestCase, self).setUp() self.res_is = mockpatch.Patch(BM_UTILS + ".resource_is") self.get_fm = mockpatch.Patch(BM_UTILS + ".get_from_manager") self.wait_for = mockpatch.Patch(MRN_UTILS + ".bench_utils.wait_for") self.wait_for_delete = mockpatch.Patch( MRN_UTILS + ".bench_utils.wait_for_delete") self.useFixture(self.wait_for) self.useFixture(self.wait_for_delete) self.useFixture(self.res_is) self.useFixture(self.get_fm) self.gfm = self.get_fm.mock self.useFixture(mockpatch.Patch("time.sleep")) def _test_atomic_action_timer(self, atomic_actions, name): action_duration = atomic_actions.get(name) self.assertIsNotNone(action_duration) self.assertIsInstance(action_duration, float) @mock.patch(MRN_UTILS + ".MuranoScenario.clients") def test_list_environments(self, mock_clients): mock_clients("murano").environments.list.return_value = [] scenario = utils.MuranoScenario() return_environments_list = scenario._list_environments() self.assertEqual([], return_environments_list) self._test_atomic_action_timer(scenario.atomic_actions(), "murano.list_environments") @mock.patch(MRN_UTILS + ".MuranoScenario.clients") def test_create_environments(self, mock_clients): mock_clients("murano").environments.create.return_value = "ENV" scenario = utils.MuranoScenario() create_env = scenario._create_environment("ENV") self.assertEqual("ENV", create_env) self._test_atomic_action_timer(scenario.atomic_actions(), "murano.create_environment") @mock.patch(MRN_UTILS + ".MuranoScenario.clients") def test_delete_environment(self, mock_clients): environment = mock.Mock() environment.id = "id" mock_clients("murano").environments.delete.return_value = "ok" scenario = utils.MuranoScenario() scenario._delete_environment(environment) mock_clients("murano").environments.delete.assert_called_once_with( environment.id ) self.wait_for_delete.mock.assert_called_once_with( environment, update_resource=self.gfm(), timeout=180) self._test_atomic_action_timer(scenario.atomic_actions(), "murano.delete_environment") @mock.patch(MRN_UTILS + ".MuranoScenario.clients") def test_create_session(self, mock_clients): mock_clients("murano").sessions.configure.return_value = "sess" scenario = utils.MuranoScenario() create_sess = scenario._create_session("id") self.assertEqual("sess", create_sess) self._test_atomic_action_timer(scenario.atomic_actions(), "murano.create_session") @mock.patch(MRN_UTILS + ".MuranoScenario._get_app", return_value={"status": "fire"}) @mock.patch(MRN_UTILS + ".MuranoScenario.clients") def test_add_app(self, mock_clients, get_app): mock_clients("murano").services.post.return_value = "app" mock_env = mock.Mock(id="fake_ip") mock_sess = mock.Mock(id="fake_ip") scenario = utils.MuranoScenario() create_app = scenario._add_app(mock_env, mock_sess, "json_path") self.assertEqual("app", create_app) self._test_atomic_action_timer(scenario.atomic_actions(), "murano.create_service") @mock.patch(MRN_UTILS + ".MuranoScenario.clients") def test_deploy_environment(self, mock_clients): environment = mock.Mock() environment.id = "id" session = mock.Mock() session.id = "id" mock_clients("murano").sessions.deploy.return_value = "ok" scenario = utils.MuranoScenario() scenario._deploy_environment(environment, session) mock_clients("murano").sessions.deploy.assert_called_once_with( environment.id, session.id ) self.wait_for.mock.assert_called_once_with( environment, update_resource=self.gfm(), is_ready=self.res_is.mock(), check_interval=2.0, timeout=1200.0) self._test_atomic_action_timer(scenario.atomic_actions(), "murano.deploy_environment") @mock.patch(MRN_UTILS + ".MuranoScenario.clients") def test_list_deployments(self, mock_clients): mock_clients("murano").deployments.list.return_value = [] scenario = utils.MuranoScenario() return_deployments_list = scenario._get_deployments_list("id") self.assertEqual([], return_deployments_list) self._test_atomic_action_timer(scenario.atomic_actions(), "murano.get_deployments_list") def test_check_deployment_status(self): deployment = mock.Mock() deployment.state = "success" scenario = utils.MuranoScenario() scenario._check_deployment_status(deployment) self._test_atomic_action_timer(scenario.atomic_actions(), "murano.check_deployment_status") def test_check_deployment_status_incorrect(self): deployment = mock.Mock() deployment.state = "sorrow" scenario = utils.MuranoScenario() self.assertRaises(rally_exceptions.RallyException, scenario._check_deployment_status, deployment)

commit_message:
Add get_current_env() to fix the decorator download_astute_yaml

@download_astute_yaml fails if wrong class is decorated:
 AttributeError: 'FuelWebClient' object has no attribute 'env'

Move class detection to the separate method and use it.

Change-Id: I1012247ead10799b4dfa87919609152125f720ba
Closes-Bug: #1401601
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/24/154024/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_current_env(args): if args[0].__class__.__name__ == "EnvironmentModel": return args[0] elif args[0].__class__.__name__ == "FuelWebClient": return args[0].environment else: logger.warning("Unexpected class!")

commit_message:
Fixing a bug in logging logic and small refactoring

* It used to log "Task 'taskName' [RUNNING -> RUNNING, result = 'result'].
  Same state twice.

Change-Id: Ie32226c08344e5b8bcb4c79d63e4a5cc7410cb11

commit_message:
Refactoring task output: renaming 'output' to 'result' for task

* The reason behing this renaming is that task being an action/workflow
  invocation doesn't have input, it configures input for action/workflow.
  So to distinguish this difference and simplify communication around
  tasks it's been decided to rename 'task output' to 'task result'.
* Fixed required unit tests
* Removed weird transformation from 'output' to 'result' in task DB model
* Removed 'output' field in task REST resource, left only 'result'
  (it caused a lot of confusion before)
* Created a stub for data flow evaluate_effective_task_result() method
  that is supposed to calculate a final task result based on task
  invocations

Change-Id: I8c0e159c5c074185e0edc1982a01ad4f525b4d11
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/26/152526/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertDictEqual({'result': 'Hey'}, task1_db.result) in_context.update(task1_db.result) self.assertDictEqual({}, task2_db.result)

subject: Refactoring task output: adding ActionInvocation model
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-02 07:21:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/e0bbbe8dbdcfe7200c802367916689bb27229d9f', 'message': 'Refactoring task output: adding TaskIteration model

* Added TaskIteration DB model to represent one execution of
  task action/workflow. So Task and TaskIterations are related
  as "one-to-many".
* Added custom LongText type that transforms to "LONGTEXT" in
  case of MySQL which has 2^32 bytes capacity.

Change-Id: I612c523b32f9a4878401d4e848ea517234521c9f
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-02 09:00:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/8414c2504bfa886e41d81c0eb878082bc00a9515', 'message': 'Refactoring task output: adding TaskInvocation model

* Added TaskIteration DB model to represent one execution of
  task action/workflow. So Task and TaskInvocation are related
  as "one-to-many".
* Added unit tests
* Added custom LongText type that transforms to "LONGTEXT" in
  case of MySQL which has 2^32 bytes capacity.
* Minor refactoring and TODOs for the upcoming work

TODO:
* Write method for calculating effective task output in all cases:
  * Task doesn't have a retry policy and 'with-items'
  * Task has retry policy
  * Task has 'with-items'
  * Task has retry policy and 'with-items' together
* Refactor engine, workflow handlers and task controller to use
  task invocations and represent task result (output) in a new form

Change-Id: I612c523b32f9a4878401d4e848ea517234521c9f

commit_message:
Refactoring task output: adding ActionInvocation model

* Added ActionInvocation DB model to represent one execution of
  task action/workflow. So Task and ActionInvocation are related
  as "one-to-many".
* Added unit tests
* Added custom LongText type that transforms to "LONGTEXT" in
  case of MySQL which has 2^32 bytes capacity.
* Minor refactoring and TODOs for the upcoming work

TODO:
* Write method for calculating effective task output in all cases:
  * Task doesn't have a retry policy and 'with-items'
  * Task has retry policy
  * Task has 'with-items'
  * Task has retry policy and 'with-items' together
* Refactor engine, workflow handlers and task controller to use
  action invocations and represent task result (output) in a new form

Change-Id: I612c523b32f9a4878401d4e848ea517234521c9f

'mistral.db.v2.sqlalchemy.models.Task', backref='iterations', cascade_backrefs='all, delete-orphan', single_parent=True, lazy='joined' )

commit_message:
Fix ceph compact upgrade jobs from 6.0 to 6.1

Environment for 6.0 is prepared via the 6.0 branch of fuel-main,
where methods and snapshots have old names.

Let get_public_ip() ability to get public IP from a controller

Change-Id: I1ffee28c977890f1cabe9ea1d0edd65a0536ed54
Related-Bug: #1419000

commit_message:
Prohibit stack check in suspend state

If stack is in suspend state it was possible to check the stack
in this state. However, there was no possibility to resume
or suspend stack again(only update, delete or create).
It simply fails because resources generate exceptions,
The patch prohibits check checking if stack is in suspend state.
In addition, added unit test for the case above.

Closes bug: #1415408

Change-Id: Ia49a997324afb17d6c18df0101ef8cbf10e8ebb5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/03/151203/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove jobs for networking-midonet patches

Remove `check-requirements` and `python3-jobs` for networking-midonet
jobs, since it blocks the development.

`pypy-jobs` are not requirement either.

Change-Id: I166bfa2c19da3e1fc438d26eabefbb4be75bee3d

commit_message:
Rackspace:LoadBalancer add address in virtualIps

This change adds IP address in virtualIps attribute.

Change-Id: I4823cd019c143464eacedf896e7768bf9a9a5f2c
Closes-Bug: #1420367

commit_message:
Add visibility filter to datastore versions

Allows datastore versions to be hidden from all users except those
explicitly allowed by their tenant. Implemented via a visibility
attribute for datastore versions (defaulting to 'public'), and a
datastore version member table for controlling access to non-public
datastore versions by tenant. Membership is controlled via a new set of
mgmt api calls.

Implements: blueprint datastore-visibility
DocImpact: visibility attr added to datastore_version show payload
Co-Authored-By: Riddhi Shah <ridhi.j.shah@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic8024a631530ba295688d7e49e895f50cb2f32ef

commit_message:
Add support for chiscsi iscsi helper

The chiscsi target works as a drop in replacement for IET/TGT with
minor configuration differences. This patch implements support for
this as the 'cxtadm' iscsi_helper.
Certification results :  https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1417499

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint chiscsi-iscsi-helper

Change-Id: Ib8e94f532cd07fea44aaeeac266e7f6750bf00c1

commit_message:
"repeat" function for HOT templates

This change introduces the "repeat" function for HOT templates, which
adds a loop control structure that iterates over the items in a list
replacing each item in a template.

Change-Id: Iba8381f2ceb7308cda0458ccdf238b23d2a3e719
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/49/140849/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ===================================== "for_each" function for HOT templates ===================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/for-each-function This specification introduces a "for-each" control structure for HOT templates. Problem description =================== Parameters of type "comma_delimited_list" are useful to specify a variable size list of items, but currently the HOT template syntax does not provide any way to map or transform those items. For example, consider the use of a parameter to specify a list of ports to include in a security group:: parameters: ports: type: comma_delimited_list label: ports default: "80,443,8080" The desired outcome, which is current not possible to obtain, is that the above parameter can be used to construct a resource as follows:: resources: security_group: type: OS::Neutron::SecurityGroup properties: name: web_server_security_group rules: - protocol: tcp port_range_min: 80 port_range_max: 80 - protocol: tcp port_range_min: 443 port_range_max: 443 - protocol: tcp port_range_min: 8080 port_range_max: 8080 Proposed change =============== This proposal introduces a new function called ``for_each`` that iterates over the elements of a list and replaces each item into a given body. Following the security group example from the previous section, this function would be used as follows:: resources: security_group: type: OS::Neutron::SecurityGroup properties: name: web_server_security_group rules: for_each: - %port% - { get_param: ports } - protocol: tcp port_range_min: %port% port_range_max: %port% The ``for_each`` function takes three arguments: the loop variable, the list to iterate on, and the content to render for each iteration. The loop variable has to be chosen carefully, as any occurrences will be replaced with the item in each iteration iteration. Variable replacement will function in the same way as in the ResourceGroup resource. It is important to note that any functions included in the body of the loop will be evaluated only once before the loop. No function evaluation will be performed after variable replacement. Alternatives ------------ None that I can think of. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: miguelgrinberg Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Kilo-1 Work Items ---------- * Implementation of the ``for_each`` function. * Unit tests. Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Correct import order in qos_specs_manage.py

The import order in cinder/api/contrib/qos_specs_manage.py doesn't
follow hacking guide http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/.
Modify them to comply with the order of stdlib, 3rd-party lib and
project imports.

Change-Id: I95a177c20f2d7a696ce7e665ae3399c9c375e65d

commit_message:
Use haproxy's http-server-close by default

At load, haproxy begins accumulating a large number of connections to
backend services stuck in TIME_WAIT state. Eventually, this leads to
stalled requests to OpenStack API services. http-server-close solves
that problem.

Change-Id: Ie405fe2d384d9d8375f60ad2c3c9885f41fe6d49
Closes-Bug: 1413104
(cherry picked from commit 6c6bfc35f779774141274579b948280518f57e2d)

commit_message:
[install-guide] do not synchronize Nova DB on openSUSE/SLES

It is not necessary to manually synchronize the Nova DB on
openSUSE/SLES because nova-manage db sync is part of the
init file.

Change-Id: If2dc3593b0352c4b88a071795a73403ffb3d3a35
Partial-Bug: 1422281
Backport: Juno

commit_message:
General updates to Compute for style and convention

Editing the nested sections for the compute chapter. Mostly grammar, wording,
style, convention, etc. This patch includes rootwrap and security. Watch this
space for more.

Change-Id: I63d9691e64f14c4eba9ca4440930f06e757f9750
Partial-Bug: #1251195
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/44/154344/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
Rootwrap allows unprivileged users to safely run Compute actions as the root user. Compute previously used sudo for this purpose, but this was difficult to maintain, and did not allow advanced filters. The rootwrap command replaces sudo for Compute. To use rootwrap, prefix the Compute command with nova-rootwrap. For example: $sudo nova-rootwrap /etc/nova/rootwrap.conf command A generic sudoers entry lets the Compute user run nova-rootwrap as root. The nova-rootwrap code looks for filter definition directories in its configuration file, and loads command filters from them. It then checks if the command requested by Compute matches one of those filters and, if so, executes the command (as root). If no filter matches, it denies the request. Be aware of issues with using NFS and root-owned files. The NFS share must be configured with the option enabled, in order for rootwrap to work correctly. Rootwrap is fully controlled by the root user. The root user owns the sudoers entry which allows Compute to run a specific rootwrap executable as root, and only with a specific configuration file (which should also be owned by root). The nova-rootwrap command imports the Python modules it needs from a cleaned, system-default PYTHONPATH. The root-owned configuration file points to root-owned filter definition directories, which contain root-owned filters definition files. This chain ensures that the Compute user itself is not in control of the configuration or modules used by the nova-rootwrap executable. Rootwrap is configured using the rootwrap.conf file. Because it's in the trusted security path, it must be owned and writable by only the root user. The file's location is specified in both the sudoers entry and in the nova.conf configuration file with the rootwrap_config=entry parameter. The rootwrap.conf file uses an INI file format with these sections and parameters:
rootwrap.conf configuration options
Configuration option=Default value (Type) Description
[DEFAULT] filters_path=/etc/nova/rootwrap.d,/usr/share/nova/rootwrap (ListOpt) Comma-separated list of directories containing filter definition files. Defines where rootwrap filters are stored. Directories defined on this line should all exist, and be owned and writable only by the root user.
The filters definition files contain lists of filters that rootwrap will use to allow or deny a specific command. They are generally suffixed by .filters. Since they are in the trusted security path, they need to be owned and writable only by the root user. Their location is specified in the rootwrap.conf file. Filter definition files use an INI file format with a [Filters] section and several lines, each with a unique parameter name (which different for each filter that you define):
.filters configuration options
Configuration option=Default value (Type) Description
[Filters] filter_name=kpartx: CommandFilter, /sbin/kpartx, root (ListOpt) Comma-separated list containing the Filter class to use, followed by the Filter arguments (which vary depending on the Filter class selected).
deleted_lines:
The root wrapper enables an unprivileged user to run a number of Compute actions as the root user in the safest manner possible. Historically, Compute used a specific sudoers file that listed every command that the Compute user was allowed to run, and used sudo to run that command as root. However this was difficult to maintain (the sudoers file was in packaging), and did not enable complex filtering of parameters (advanced filters). The rootwrap was designed to solve those issues. How rootwrap works Instead of calling sudo make me a sandwich, Compute services start with a nova-rootwrap call; for example, sudo nova-rootwrap /etc/nova/rootwrap.conf make me a sandwich. A generic sudoers entry lets the Compute user run nova-rootwrap as root. The nova-rootwrap code looks for filter definition directories in its configuration file, and loads command filters from them. Then it checks if the command requested by Compute matches one of those filters, in which case it executes the command (as root). If no filter matches, it denies the request. To use nova-rootwrap, you must be aware of the issues with using NFS and root-owned files. The NFS share must be configured with the option enabled. Security model The escalation path is fully controlled by the root user. A sudoers entry (owned by root) allows Compute to run (as root) a specific rootwrap executable, and only with a specific configuration file (which should be owned by root). nova-rootwrap imports the Python modules it needs from a cleaned (and system-default) PYTHONPATH. The configuration file (also root-owned) points to root-owned filter definition directories, which contain root-owned filters definition files. This chain ensures that the Compute user itself is not in control of the configuration or modules used by the nova-rootwrap executable. Details of rootwrap.conf You configure nova-rootwrap in the rootwrap.conf file. Because it's in the trusted security path, it must be owned and writable by only the root user. The file's location is specified both in the sudoers entry and in the nova.conf configuration file with the rootwrap_config=entry. The rootwrap.conf file uses an INI file format with these sections and parameters:
rootwrap.conf configuration options
Configuration option=Default value (Type) Description
[DEFAULT] filters_path=/etc/nova/rootwrap.d,/usr/share/nova/rootwrap (ListOpt) Comma-separated list of directories containing filter definition files. Defines where filters for root wrap are stored. Directories defined on this line should all exist, be owned and writable only by the root user.
Details of .filters files Filters definition files contain lists of filters that nova-rootwrap will use to allow or deny a specific command. They are generally suffixed by .filters. Since they are in the trusted security path, they need to be owned and writable only by the root user. Their location is specified in the rootwrap.conf file. Filter definition files use an INI file format with a [Filters] section and several lines, each with a unique parameter name (different for each filter that you define):
.filters configuration options
Configuration option=Default value (Type) Description
[Filters] filter_name=kpartx: CommandFilter, /sbin/kpartx, root (ListOpt) Comma-separated list containing first the Filter class to use, followed by that Filter arguments (which vary depending on the Filter class selected).

subject: Add a domain to federated users
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-31 06:06:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/9de15c61aa7a6debb3ae845951d2cf77a957ace8', 'message': "Add a domain to federated users

Currently in the token returned from keystone, for a federated
user, the 'domain' section is missing. This was as designed, since
federated users do not exist in keystone. However this was caused
some issues with the upcoming non-persistent tokens, as well as
keystonemiddleware.

The solution should be to add a domain section, made up of the
IDP values, for both ID and name of the domain.

Change-Id: I4ad9fb55e8258e091ac78f628e5cb5b3add611a3
Related-Bug: #1346820
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-31 17:26:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/d0e93da45d3146402f4ca834c898bd5b54d23508', 'message': "Add a domain to federated users

user, the 'domain' section is missing. This was as designed, since
federated users do not exist in keystone. However this was caused
some issues with the upcoming non-persistent tokens, as well as
keystonemiddleware.

The solution should be to add a domain section, where we use a

commit_message:
Add a domain to federated users

Currently in the token returned from keystone, for a federated
user, the 'domain' section is missing. This was as designed, since
federated users do not exist in keystone. However this was caused
some issues with the upcoming non-persistent tokens, as well as
keystonemiddleware.

The solution should be to add a domain section, where we use a
reserved value of 'Federated', for both ID and name of the domain.

Change-Id: I4ad9fb55e8258e091ac78f628e5cb5b3add611a3
Implements bp federated-direct-user-mapping
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/58/110858/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'group_ids': group_ids, federation.IDENTITY_PROVIDER: identity_provider, federation.PROTOCOL: protocol

subject: Removal of uneeded guest mount_point from taskmgr
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-11 06:39:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/01e902578a9a90ee0e574adf1e1f67338f11e715', 'message': 'Removal of uneeded guest mount_point from taskmgr

In an effort to promote a better seperation of concerns between
the taskmanager and the guest impls, the mount_point was identifed
as a field the taskmanager didnt actually use. By removing the
mount_point from the taskmanager, we are closer to being able to
provide a custom guest implmenentation without affecting the
existing impls and taskmanager. This is also an effort to better
define the contract between the guest and the taskmanager.

partially implements refactoring-datastore-options-in-cfg

Change-Id: If0f6f375aa74e6ac40a5ccefd0a6b2b0e7e04ab0

In an effort to promote a better seperation of concerns between
the taskmanager and the guest impls, the mount_point was identifed
as a field the taskmanager didnt actually use. By removing the
mount_point from the taskmanager, we are closer to being able to
provide a custom guest implmenentation without affecting the
existing impls and taskmanager. This is also an effort to better
define the contract between the guest and the taskmanager.

If the guestagent API detects that the user has provided a mount_point
argument, an error is issued. This sets us up to being able to rev the
API at some point and eliminate the argument. But, that's a matter for
another day.

partially implements: blueprint refactoring-datastore-options-in-cfg
Co-Authored-By: Michael Basnight <mbasnight@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Removal of uneeded guest mount_point from taskmgr

In an effort to promote a better seperation of concerns between
the taskmanager and the guest impls, the mount_point was identifed
as a field the taskmanager didnt actually use. By removing the
mount_point from the taskmanager, we are closer to being able to
provide a custom guest implmenentation without affecting the
existing impls and taskmanager. This is also an effort to better
define the contract between the guest and the taskmanager.

If the guestagent API detects that the user has provided a mount_point
argument, an error is issued. This sets us up to being able to rev the
API at some point and eliminate the argument. But, that's a matter for
another day.

Resubmitting with a manual rebase to kick out the Deprecated TroveCI

Closes-Bug: #1346881
Co-Authored-By: Michael Basnight <mbasnight@gmail.com>

Change-Id: If0f6f375aa74e6ac40a5ccefd0a6b2b0e7e04ab0

subject: Set name on container returned by create_container
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-16 22:11:22.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/object_store/v1/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/object_store/v1/_proxy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/dcc0ea63d503559965c5240cdadd9490ba0bb3b0', 'message': "Set name on container returned by create_container

Since the underlying PUT to /containers doesn't return a new body, we're
not returning anything useful out of the object_store.create_container
proxy except for the headers that come back. Since we have the name, we
can set the name property on the object so it's actually useful to build
on. Right now you can't create a container and then build objects on it
since you lost the name.

The test in the change is because before we had the mock return itself,
which already had the name attribute set. Now we return a blank
Container and ensure that line 109 does its job in setting that name.

Change-Id: Iaab8595ec505cd90a18d71c5da4e066fd96661fb
Closes-Bug: 1422503
"}]
commit_message:
Set name on container returned by create_container

Since the underlying PUT to /containers doesn't return a new body, we're
not returning anything useful out of the object_store.create_container
proxy except for the headers that come back. Since we have the name, we
can set the name property on the object so it's actually useful to build
on. Right now you can't create a container and then build objects on it
since you lost the name.

The test in the change is because before we had the mock return itself,
which already had the name attribute set. Now we return a blank
Container and ensure that line 109 does its job in setting that name.

Change-Id: Iaab8595ec505cd90a18d71c5da4e066fd96661fb
Closes-Bug: 1422503
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/91/156391/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name = container.name # This create doesn't return a body, so set the name on the returned # body so the container is useful. created = container.create(self.session) created.name = name return created

commit_message:
Updated the dev install docs

Updated with information about:
- Cleaner install workflow using devstack
- Steps to run integration tests
- General house-cleaning of docs

Change-Id: Ie4d916414374a8f70e3e40c45c2a05dffd18661b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/78/107278/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Trove is constantly under development. Trove can be installed using devstack. To set up an enviro------------------------------- Installing trove using devstack -------------------------------* Clone the devstack repo:: # git clone https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack.git * cd into the devstack directory::* create the following localrc file with the appropriate configuration option values, and services enabled:: # cat << EOF >> localrc MYSQL_PASSWORD=e1a2c042c828d3566d0a RABBIT_PASSWORD=f7999d1955c5014aa32c SERVICE_TOKEN=be19c524ddc92109a224 ADMIN_PASSWORD=3de4922d8b6ac5a1aad9 SERVICE_PASSWORD=7de4162d826bc5a11ad9 PUBLIC_INTERFACE=eth0 ENABLED_SERVICES+=,trove,tr-api,tr-tmgr,tr-cond # Trove also requires swift to be enabled for backup / restore ENABLED_SERVICES+=,s-proxy,s-object,s-container,s-account SWIFT_HASH=12go358snjw24501 # Optionally you can choose to enable tempest, and/or heat # ENABLED_SERVICES+=,tempest # ENABLED_SERVICES+=,heat,h-api,h-api-cfn,h-api-cw,h-eng EOF * Run devstack # ./stack.sh * Add the trove public key to the user's authorized_keys file. The trove guest image rsyncs the guestagent bits from the $DEST/trove on the host (/opt/stack/trove by default), so the guest-agent needs access to these bits on the host box. # cat << EOF >> ~/.ssh/authorized_keys ssh-rsa  trove@devstack EOF * Congrats! You now have a working trove installation. You can test out your trove installation by spinning up a new trove instance. # source ~/devstack/openrc demo demo # trove create test-instance 2 --size 1Running Trove Integration Tests* In order to run the trove integration tests, we will need to clone the trove-integration repository. # git clone https://github.com/openstack/trove-integration.git * Redstack is the core script that allows you to interact with your developer installation of Trove. You can get the command list with a short description of each command and what it does:: # cd trove-integration/scripts* To set up our environment to run integration tests, we need run the test-init command, specifying that we are going to need to install the trove private ssh key (some tests ssh into the guest instance to ensure the datastore is running):: # export KEY_DIR=`pwd`/files/keys # ./redstack test-init * You are now ready to run the trove integration tests in your environment! Give it a whirl. # ./redstack int-tests
deleted_lines: Trove is constantly under development. The easiest way to install---------------------------- Installing trove-integration ----------------------------* Clone this repo:: # git clone https://github.com/openstack/trove-integration.git * cd into the scripts directory::Running redstack to install TroveRedstack is the core script that allows you to install and interact with your developer installation of Trove. Redstack has the following options that you can run. * Get the command list with a short description of each command and what it does:: * Install all the dependencies and then install Trove. This brings up trove (rd-api rd-tmgr) and initializes the trove database:: # ./redstack install * Kick start the build/test-init/build-image commands. Add mysql as a parameter to set build and add the mysql guest image:: # ./redstack kick-start mysql * You probably need to add this iptables rule, so be sure to save it!:: # sudo iptables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -s 10.0.0.0/24 -o eth0 -j MASQUERADE

commit_message:
Adds backup/restore support for mongodb

Adds support to do full backups and restore mongodb single instance

Changes:

Added mongo_impl for backup and restore strategies
Updated backupagent.py to load backup_namespace and
        restore_namespace from config group section
Updated manager to invoke backup and restore
Updated common/cfg.py to load group attribs (backup_namespace,
                restore_namespace etc under [mongodb], [mysql]
Increased timeout for utils.execute() that execs mongorestore cmd

Co-Authored-By: Ramashri Umale <rumale@ebaysf.com>
Implements: blueprint backups-single-instance-mongodb
Change-Id: I67e0bc0890f64744a39a3ce097a4887f2c6a4174

subject: Removes '.' from GuestError exception message
revisions:

commit_message:
Removes '.' from GuestError exception message

Reasons:
- GuestError exception message is used to show an original_message
  and also adds a period '.' at end, but many-a-times, the
  original_message contains '.' at end, and the message gets to
  have '..' at end.

Changes:
- Removed the '.' from GuestError exception message.
- Added the '.' to the exception messages raised from volume.py,
  because it should be the responsibility to send '.'
  at end of message.

Change-Id: Ib1357f063f39b8544f341895bc164f33e69394fe
Closes-Bug: #1290925

commit_message:
Install Redis before changing owner of mount point

The redis user and group do not exist before installing
the package, therefore the ownership change must be done
after the installation.

Change-Id: I7dcf3034aebf9e8961b6a89e573360522f8511cd
Closes-Bug: #1383621

subject: Add instance ID validation stage while creating incremental backup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-23 13:02:51.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/exception.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/backup/test_backup_models.py', 'trove/common/wsgi.py', 'trove/backup/models.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/b1a6ff547b14b70c03dddf1ef30748425140e018', 'message': 'Add instance ID validation stage while creating incremental backup

Reasons:
 - user is able to create incremental backup
   using parent backup taken from another instance.

Changes:
 - adding instance validation stage while
   attempting to create incremental backup;
 - unit/int tests proposed.

Behaviour:
 - when attempting to create incremental backup by using
   parent from different instance server side
   will raise ParentBackupIDMismatch exception;
 - from user perspective exception will be interpreted
   as HTTP Forbidden(403) according to RFC 2616 -- Trove server site
   understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill
   it due to IDs mismatch.

Change-Id: I1eef06c887e2e1acc3b101d4294b22c3470e6b87
Closes-Bug: #1344133
'}]
commit_message:
Add instance ID validation stage while creating incremental backup

Reasons:
 - user is able to create incremental backup
   using parent backup taken from another instance.

Changes:
 - adding instance validation stage while
   attempting to create incremental backup;
 - unit/int tests proposed.

Behaviour:
 - when attempting to create incremental backup by using
   parent from different instance server side
   will raise ParentBackupIDMismatch exception;
 - from user perspective exception will be interpreted
   as HTTP Forbidden(403) according to RFC 2616 -- Trove server site
   understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill
   it due to IDs mismatch.

Change-Id: I1eef06c887e2e1acc3b101d4294b22c3470e6b87
Closes-Bug: #1344133
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/22/130522/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if instance_id != _parent.instance_id: raise exception.ParentBackupInstanceIDMismatchError( expected=_parent.instance_id, actual=instance_id)

subject: Fix parent backup state validation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-22 13:52:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/afdd8549ab72ef9ff8541887394adf10124ec940', 'message': "Fix parent backup state validation

Reasons:
 - there's no parent backup checks at incremental
   backup creation step, so, users are allowed to
   attempt to create incremental backup with FAILED parent.

Changes:
 - adding validation step that checks parent backup
   state and raises exception if it's FAILED;
 - parent validation was moved to speed up failing
   if backup is FAILED;
 - unit/int tests proposed.

 Behaviour:
 - server will raise ParentBackupFailedError;
 - from user perspective error will be interpreted
   as HTTP Forbidden(403) according to RFC 2616.

Change-Id: I498026570bf8e91da9b5e0a71c66050d5521fe8d
Closes-Bug: #1340163

commit_message:
Fix parent backup state validation

Reasons:
 - there's no parent backup checks at incremental
   backup creation step, so, users are allowed to
   attempt to create incremental backup with FAILED parent.

Changes:
 - adding validation step that checks parent backup
   state and raises exception if it's FAILED;
 - parent validation was moved to speed up failing
   if backup is FAILED;
 - unit/int tests proposed.

 Behaviour:
 - server will raise ParentBackupFailedError;
 - from user perspective error will be interpreted
   as HTTP Forbidden(403) according to RFC 2616.

Change-Id: I498026570bf8e91da9b5e0a71c66050d5521fe8d
Closes-Bug: #1340163
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/23/130223/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parent = None if parent_id: # Look up the parent info or fail early if not found or if # the user does not have access to the parent. _parent = cls.get_by_id(context, parent_id) if _parent.is_failed: raise exception.ParentBackupFailedError( backup_id=_parent.id) parent = { 'location': _parent.location, 'checksum': _parent.checksum, }
deleted_lines: parent = None if parent_id: # Look up the parent info or fail early if not found or if # the user does not have access to the parent. _parent = cls.get_by_id(context, parent_id) parent = { 'location': _parent.location, 'checksum': _parent.checksum, }

commit_message:
Fix replica source state validation

Reasons:
 - creating a slave for instance Trove
   doesn't validate that master exist,
 - replica source is not proper state.
   In this case trove-api needs to check
   if replica source is  ACTIVE and raise
   HTTP 422 UnprocessableEntity in cases when
   status is not ACTIVE

Changes:
 - adding validation step that checks if master exists and in proper state.

Change-Id: I731d75c1463fbcb4d9795756f9b38f7e8ae37c9c
Closes-Bug: #1357704

commit_message:
Make storage strategy available for trove API and TM

The storage strategy is only available for guestagent code.
This needs to be made available for API and taskmanager so
that it can access the storage to authenticate, copy or
delete backups. The bulk of the work is just moving the
storage strategy code from the guestagent package to the
trove common.

partially implements: blueprint cross-region-backup-availability

Change-Id: I4d806b5f5c61db489581cd78838fea178dbc113d

commit_message:
Get default configuration for version + flavor

This patch allows users to get the default config on a datastore version
flavor so they can know what the defaults are when creating a config
group that is not attached to an instance. This will help give a clear
description of what the config values are before making "custom" changes
to the config group.

Changes:
  - New API path which returns the default config for a specified
    datastore version and flavor

Change-Id: I306285916e5833b96aedf3b4909dece3a7d1aae1
Implements: blueprint default-config-values-for-datastore-version-flavor
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/64/113764/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class DefaultConfigurationParametersView(object): def __init__(self, datastore, version, flavor, config): self.param_dict = { "flavor": flavor.id, "datastore": datastore.name, "datastore_version": version.name, "configuration": dict(), } # assume config is a list of tuples for (k, v) in config: self.param_dict['configuration'][k] = v def data(self): return self.param_dict

commit_message:
Octavia Controller Worker specification

Initial draft of a spec for the Controller Worker, formerly known as
deploy-worker.

Change-Id: If17bac321275b6cc1137574f37837dfe220606d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/01/149801/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================== Controller Worker (deploy-worker) ================================== Launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/octavia/+spec/deploy-worker Octavia is an operator-grade reference implementation for Load Balancing as a Service (LBaaS) for OpenStack. The component of Octavia that does the load balancing is known as Amphora. The component of Octavia that provides command and control of the Amphora is the Octavia controller. Problem description =================== Components of the Octavia controller require a shared library that provides the orchestration of create/update/delete actions for Octavia objects such as load balancers and listeners. It is expected that this library will be used by the Queue Consumer to service API requests, by the Housekeeping Manager to manage the spare Amphora pool, and by the Health Manager to fail over failed objects. Proposed change =============== The Controller Worker will be implemented as a class that provides methods to facilitate the create/update/delete actions. This class will be responsible for managing the number of simultaneous operations being executed by coordinating through the Octavia database. The Controller Worker will provide a base class that sets up and initilizes the TaskFlow engines required to complete the action. Users of the library will then call the appropriate method for the action. These methods setup and launch the appropriate flow. Each flow will be contained in a seperate class for code reuse and supportability. The Controller Worker library will provide the following methods: .. code:: python def create_amphora(self): """ Creates an Amphora. :returns: amphora_id """ raise NotImplementedError def delete_amphora(self, amphora_id): """ Deletes an existing Amphora. :returns: None :raises AmphoraNotFound: The referenced Amphora was not found """ raise NotImplementedError def create_load_balancer(self, load_balancer_id): """ Creates a load balancer by allocating Amphorae. :returns: None :raises NoSuitableAmphora: Unable to allocate an Amphora. """ raise NotImplementedError def update_load_balancer(self, load_balancer_id): """ Updates a load balancer. :returns: None :raises LBNotFound: The referenced load balancer was not found """ raise NotImplementedError def delete_load_balancer(self, load_balancer_id): """ Deletes a load balancer by de-allocating Amphorae. :returns: None :raises LBNotFound: The referenced load balancer was not found """ raise NotImplementedError def create_listener(self, listener_id): """ Creates a listener. :returns: None :raises NoSuitableLB: Unable to find the load balancer """ raise NotImplementedError def update_listener(self, listener_id): """ Updates a listener. :returns: None :raises ListenerNotFound: The referenced listener was not found """ raise NotImplementedError def delete_listener(self, listener_id): """ Deletes a listener. :returns: None :raises ListenerNotFound: The referenced listener was not found """ raise NotImplementedError def create_pool(self, pool_id): """ Creates a node pool. :returns: None :raises NoSuitableLB: Unable to find the load balancer """ raise NotImplementedError def update_pool(self, pool_id): """ Updates a node pool. :returns: None :raises PoolNotFound: The referenced pool was not found """ raise NotImplementedError def delete_pool(self, pool_id): """ Deletes a node pool. :returns: None :raises PoolNotFound: The referenced pool was not found """ raise NotImplementedError def create_health_monitor(self, health_monitor_id): """ Creates a health monitor. :returns: None :raises NoSuitablePool: Unable to find the node pool """ raise NotImplementedError def update_health_monitor(self, health_monitor_id): """ Updates a health monitor. :returns: None :raises HMNotFound: The referenced health monitor was not found """ raise NotImplementedError def delete_health_monitor(self, health_monitor_id): """ Deletes a health monitor. :returns: None :raises HMNotFound: The referenced health monitor was not found """ raise NotImplementedError def create_member(self, member_id): """ Creates a pool member. :returns: None :raises NoSuitablePool: Unable to find the node pool """ raise NotImplementedError def update_member(self, member_id): """ Updates a pool member. :returns: None :raises MemberNotFound: The referenced member was not found """ raise NotImplementedError def delete_member(self, member_id): """ Deletes a pool member. :returns: None :raises MemberNotFound: The referenced member was not found """ raise NotImplementedError Alternatives ------------ Data model impact ----------------- REST API impact --------------- Security impact --------------- Notifications impact -------------------- Other end user impact --------------------- Performance Impact ------------------ Other deployer impact --------------------- Developer impact ---------------- Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Michael Johnson <johnsom> Work Items ---------- Dependencies ============ Testing ======= Documentation Impact ==================== References ==========

subject: Tests: Don't require binding to port 4444
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-13 18:20:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_wsgi.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/8b0d47e7156563e0b64afcf3aa1b95f1f177d334', 'message': "Tests: Don't require binding to port 4444

If some other process is listening on port 4444,
test_server_pool_waitall will fail with:

RuntimeError: Could not bind to 127.0.0.1:4444 after
trying for 30 seconds

This test doesn't require use of this specific port,
so let it pick an unused port to avoid this failure.

Closes-Bug: #1421759

Change-Id: I7e6d6f574cd2bbb2fa067001bba4b09b5204a5e1
"}]
commit_message:
Tests: Don't require binding to port 4444

If some other process is listening on port 4444,
test_server_pool_waitall will fail with:

RuntimeError: Could not bind to 127.0.0.1:4444 after
trying for 30 seconds

This test doesn't require use of this specific port,
so let it pick an unused port to avoid this failure.

Closes-Bug: #1421759

Change-Id: I7e6d6f574cd2bbb2fa067001bba4b09b5204a5e1

commit_message:
Add index on tenant_id

Adding index on tenant_id could greatly speed up SELECTs with
filters by tenant_id when some value is selected per resource
per tenant.
As a continuation part of https://review.openstack.org/143120 for
service tables.

Change-Id: I9f67a82b0e0a493ff8b39424296699e7e517e9df
Partial-bug: #1419815

Add index on tenant_id

Adding index on tenant_id could greatly speed up SELECTs with
filters by tenant_id when some value is selected per resource
per tenant.
As a continuation part of https://review.openstack.org/143120 for
service tables.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-27 17:35:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/v2_0/client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/68fc402ee99592e68afe0edce0d231f0bc332c20', 'message': 'Split base function of v2_0.Client into a separate class

v2_0.Client now contains both base features of HTTP clients
and API methods which talk to Neutron server. We have so many
API methods now and it is not easy to find the base features
from the class.
This commit just split the base features into ClientBase.

Change-Id: I00b78569ad09efc59624ee73a6786d77226bda20
'}]
commit_message:
Split base function of v2_0.Client into a separate class

v2_0.Client now contains both base features of HTTP clients
and API methods which talk to Neutron server. We have so many
API methods now and it is not easy to find the base features
from the class.
This commit just split the base features into ClientBase.

Change-Id: I00b78569ad09efc59624ee73a6786d77226bda20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/12/150512/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ClientBase(object): # API has no way to report plurals, so we have to hard code them # This variable should be overridden by a child class. EXTED_PLURALS = {} def __init__(self, **kwargs): """Initialize a new client for the Neutron v2.0 API.""" super(ClientBase, self).__init__() self.retries = kwargs.pop('retries', 0) self.raise_errors = kwargs.pop('raise_errors', True) self.httpclient = client.construct_http_client(**kwargs) self.version = '2.0' self.format = 'json' self.action_prefix = "/v%s" % (self.version) self.retry_interval = 1 def _handle_fault_response(self, status_code, response_body): # Create exception with HTTP status code and message _logger.debug("Error message: %s", response_body) # Add deserialized error message to exception arguments try: des_error_body = self.deserialize(response_body, status_code) except Exception: # If unable to deserialized body it is probably not a # Neutron error des_error_body = {'message': response_body} # Raise the appropriate exception exception_handler_v20(status_code, des_error_body) def do_request(self, method, action, body=None, headers=None, params=None): # Add format and tenant_id action += ".%s" % self.format action = self.action_prefix + action if type(params) is dict and params: params = utils.safe_encode_dict(params) action += '?' + urlparse.urlencode(params, doseq=1) if body: body = self.serialize(body) resp, replybody = self.httpclient.do_request( action, method, body=body, content_type=self.content_type()) status_code = resp.status_code if status_code in (requests.codes.ok, requests.codes.created, requests.codes.accepted, requests.codes.no_content): return self.deserialize(replybody, status_code) else: if not replybody: replybody = resp.reason self._handle_fault_response(status_code, replybody) def get_auth_info(self): return self.httpclient.get_auth_info() def serialize(self, data): """Serializes a dictionary into either XML or JSON. A dictionary with a single key can be passed and it can contain any structure. """ if data is None: return None elif type(data) is dict: return serializer.Serializer( self.get_attr_metadata()).serialize(data, self.content_type()) else: raise Exception(_("Unable to serialize object of type = '%s'") % type(data)) def deserialize(self, data, status_code): """Deserializes an XML or JSON string into a dictionary.""" if status_code == 204: return data return serializer.Serializer(self.get_attr_metadata()).deserialize( data, self.content_type())['body'] def get_attr_metadata(self): if self.format == 'json': return {} old_request_format = self.format self.format = 'json' exts = self.list_extensions()['extensions'] self.format = old_request_format ns = dict([(ext['alias'], ext['namespace']) for ext in exts]) self.EXTED_PLURALS.update(constants.PLURALS) return {'plurals': self.EXTED_PLURALS, 'xmlns': constants.XML_NS_V20, constants.EXT_NS: ns} def content_type(self, _format=None): """Returns the mime-type for either 'xml' or 'json'. Defaults to the currently set format. """ _format = _format or self.format return "application/%s" % (_format) def retry_request(self, method, action, body=None, headers=None, params=None): """Call do_request with the default retry configuration. Only idempotent requests should retry failed connection attempts. :raises: ConnectionFailed if the maximum # of retries is exceeded """ max_attempts = self.retries + 1 for i in range(max_attempts): try: return self.do_request(method, action, body=body, headers=headers, params=params) except exceptions.ConnectionFailed: # Exception has already been logged by do_request() if i < self.retries: _logger.debug('Retrying connection to Neutron service') time.sleep(self.retry_interval) elif self.raise_errors: raise if self.retries: msg = (_("Failed to connect to Neutron server after %d attempts") % max_attempts) else: msg = _("Failed to connect Neutron server") raise exceptions.ConnectionFailed(reason=msg) def delete(self, action, body=None, headers=None, params=None): return self.retry_request("DELETE", action, body=body, headers=headers, params=params) def get(self, action, body=None, headers=None, params=None): return self.retry_request("GET", action, body=body, headers=headers, params=params) def post(self, action, body=None, headers=None, params=None): # Do not retry POST requests to avoid the orphan objects problem. return self.do_request("POST", action, body=body, headers=headers, params=params) def put(self, action, body=None, headers=None, params=None): return self.retry_request("PUT", action, body=body, headers=headers, params=params) def list(self, collection, path, retrieve_all=True, **params): if retrieve_all: res = [] for r in self._pagination(collection, path, **params): res.extend(r[collection]) return {collection: res} else: return self._pagination(collection, path, **params) def _pagination(self, collection, path, **params): if params.get('page_reverse', False): linkrel = 'previous' else: linkrel = 'next' next = True while next: res = self.get(path, params=params) yield res next = False try: for link in res['%s_links' % collection]: if link['rel'] == linkrel: query_str = urlparse.urlparse(link['href']).query params = urlparse.parse_qs(query_str) next = True break except KeyError: break class Client(ClientBase):

commit_message:
Add ip_version to extra dhcp opts

Add ip_version to port-create and port-update option
--extra-dhcp-opt.

Change-Id: I0976ed0ada0a174c475c725ab8c7eb89b33f61ca
Partially-implements: Blueprint extra-dhcp-opts-ipv4-ipv6

commit_message:
Use oslo.log instead of incubator

Most of changes are just replacing

from keystone.openstack.common import log
  with
from oslo_log import log

There are some other specific changes that had to be made
  * Initialize logger in keystone/config.py

Change-Id: I859edb71c434051ffe7f34c16018b738ddb71e3b

commit_message:
Deprecate keystone CLI

bp deprecate-cli

Change-Id: Ia0170afc1476e531b1348c1faee47cfa5886dd96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/59/155159/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================== Deprecate keystone CLI ====================== `bp deprecate-cli <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/python-keystoneclient/+spec/deprecate-cli>`_ The ``keystone`` CLI is superceded by the OpenStack unified CLI (OSC), so let's get rid of it as soon as we can. Problem Description =================== The ``keystone`` CLI is superceded by OSC, as such it's a waste for us to continue maintaining it. Since we can't just delete it we need to deprecate it first. Proposed Change =============== The ``keystone`` CLI will print out Python's usual deprecation warning message when it's run. By using Python's regular warnings module users can disable the warning message, see https://docs.python.org/2/using/cmdline.html#cmdoption-W The help text (``keystone --help``) will be updated to also say that the command is deprecated. This is part of a larger effort to get rid of the ``keystone`` command for good. Alternatives ------------ a) Engage in a major effort to fully support the ``keystone`` command, including implement all the identity V3 commands, duplicating the work of the OSC. b) Make ``keystone`` a wrapper around the OSC. Security Impact --------------- The ``keystone`` CLI will only be patched for security and critical fixes since it's deprecated. Notifications Impact -------------------- None. Notifications don't use the ``keystone`` CLI. Other End User Impact --------------------- Users will see a message every time unless they use -W to disable the warnings. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- Deployers will eventually need to move to using the unified CLI. Developer Impact ---------------- Developers will need to move to using the unified CLI. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <blk-u> Brant Knudson Work Items ---------- * Change ``keystone`` CLI to print the deprecation warning when run. * Change ``keystone`` help text to print that it's deprecated. * Change ``keystone`` man page to say that it's deprecated. Dependencies ============ None. Documentation Impact ==================== The documentation should change all ``keystone`` commands to the equivalent ``openstack`` command. References ========== * https://docs.python.org/2/using/cmdline.html#cmdoption-W * http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-openstackclient/

commit_message:
service-split should not add in entries from the *aas conf files

Submittion I16b5e5b2 [1] trys to read config entries out of
neutron-{service}.conf which will deprive the change for neutron
service projects to override config entries in their unit tests.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151375/

Change-Id: I628598a6f7bdfcb69e8f55159eb1779e94471b48
Closes-Bug: #1420139

commit_message:
Add 'type' parameter to compute image schema

Compute image API returns a response which includes 'type' parameter,
but the parameter was not defined in the response schema.
This patch adds it.

Change-Id: I3eee9783da51084200e188ab0c25c7ae7433831e

commit_message:
Fix MagnumException for parsing custom message

Change-Id: Iddb33497d78d2f54666b0ea7be63fc36478e805e
Closes-Bug: 1422441
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/10/156310/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if message: self.message = message try: self.message = self.message % kwargs except Exception as e: # kwargs doesn't match a variable in the message # log the issue and the kwargs LOG.exception(_LE('Exception in string format operation')) for name, value in kwargs.iteritems(): LOG.error("%s: %s" % (name, value)) if CONF.fatal_exception_format_errors: raise e
deleted_lines: if not message: try: self.message = self.message % kwargs except Exception as e: # kwargs doesn't match a variable in the message # log the issue and the kwargs LOG.exception(_LE('Exception in string format operation')) for name, value in kwargs.iteritems(): LOG.error("%s: %s" % (name, value)) if CONF.fatal_exception_format_errors: raise e else: # at least get the core message out if something happened message = self.message

commit_message:
Allow Json patch to take an integer value

This commit allows clients to send a Json patch with integer value, which is
necessary for modifying an integer field (i.e. node_count) of a controller.

Partially implements: blueprint update-node-count
Change-Id: I25ee80bbbbc1d74a8e577038107ae2b2afe11192

Convergence Database schema changes

- https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/convergence-parameter-storage
- https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/convergence-resource-locking
- https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/convergence-resource-table

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/02/152302/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ============================= Add extra data to the Stack table for convergence ============================= Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/convergence-stack-data Problem description =================== The convergence design requires extra data to be stored with each Stack row in order to manage concurrent updates. Proposed change =============== Add the following extra fields to the Stack table: - `prev_tmpl_key` (a RawTemplate key) - `current-traversal` (an integer that gets incremented on each update) - `current-deps` (a list of edges in the dependency graph) We also need to ensure that modifications to the Stack table are atomic with respect to the `current-traversal` field - if a new traversal starts then any previous traversals should stop updating the stack data. This should be achieved using the "UPDATE ... WHERE ..." form as discussed in http://www.joinfu.com/2015/01/understanding-reservations-concurrency-locking-in-nova/ Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: unmesh-gurjar Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Kilo-3 Work Items ---------- - Add the database migration - Ensure that updates are atomic w.r.t. `current_traversal` Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Remove internal items from public namespace

This removes several things from the public namespace of base.py, which are
internal implementation details. It also changes the special name used to store
an actual attribute from just _$name to _obj_$name to avoid obvious and simple
collisions. We use "obj_" in a lot of places for things built into the base
object, so that seems appropriate.

Change-Id: Ic6f4f0e0e71c1d8574292eb44aa925dfbf329d8b

Put dbname in the path section of postgresql URL

This makes it easier to manipulate the name of the database when
using sqlalchemy-utils' url parser.

commit_message:
Fixes error message during volume snapshot creation

When a user who is close to his quota tries to create a volume snapshot,
he sees the error message "Unable to create volume snapshot" which does
not provide any details about the real error. This patch will show a
detailed error message to the user.

Change-Id: I9b4af3f9bf5a9bc65c677e664668d0c2c1a3a3d5
Closes-Bug: #1421317
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/10/156110/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except Exception as e: msg = _('Unable to create volume snapshot.') if e.code == 413: msg = _('Requested snapshot exceeds allowed Gigabytes quota.') msg,
deleted_lines: except Exception: _('Unable to create volume snapshot.'),

commit_message:
Add floating-IP aware VM boot/delete utils

Refactor `boot_runcommand_delete` into `_boot_server_with_fip` and
`_delete_server_with_fip` that are aware of networks and assign
floating IPs.

Change-Id: If51895ac3b045fcf15cf601ed23d6cacd502a321

commit_message:
Implements: Blueprint update-image-build-script

Previously, the image used for Kolla development
needed to be manually created. This patch adds a
script to automate a consistent, repeatable process
for creating an F21 image used for Kolla development.

Change-Id: Ibbe41ac6c6f1d2f2bdd62a48b05c096967c8324e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/56/155456/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # This script expects the following to be installed: # curl, libguestfs-tools-c IMAGE=Fedora-Cloud-Base-20141203-21.x86_64.qcow2 TARGET_DIR=/var/lib/libvirt/images TARGET=fedora-21-x86_64 if ! [ -f "$IMAGE" ]; then echo "Downloading $IMAGE" curl -O http://archive.fedoraproject.org/pub/fedora/linux/releases/21/Cloud/Images/x86_64/$IMAGE fi echo "Copying $IMAGE to $TARGET" cp "$IMAGE" $TARGET_DIR/$TARGET PACKAGES="git,tcpdump" virt-customize \ --add $TARGET_DIR/$TARGET \ --install $PACKAGES \ --update \ --install $PACKAGES \ --run-command "yum clean all" \ --run-command "cat > /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-eth1 <<EOF DEVICE=eth1 BOOTPROTO=none ONBOOT=yes DEFROUTE=no EOF" \ --root-password password:password # SELinux relabeling requires virt-customize to have networking disabled # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1122907 virt-customize --add $TARGET_DIR/$TARGET --selinux-relabel --no-network echo "Finished building image:" ls -l $TARGET_DIR/$TARGET

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-09 15:16:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/877ecbbeb0e35db6fb53af606b938bbedb60653c', 'message': 'Allow the gate-hook script to install only deps

This is a preliminary effort to improve the efficiency of preparing a
host to run the dsvm-functional tox env.  The goal is to install only
neutron and its dependencies rather than installing running a full
suite of services and then having to unstack.

This first pass targets a development host since iterating locally is
faster than having to run gate jobs, and it will be useful to be able
to repeatably build the functional test env on a development machine.

To test locally, you need to set the following environment variables
either in your bash session or by directly editing the script:

NEUTRON_PATH=/home/user/neutron
DEVSTACK_PATH=/home/user/devstack
IS_GATE=False

On a clean host with the above configuration, running gate_hook.sh has
allowed me to successfully run tox -e dsvm-functional.

Change-Id: Iaf43be458bdf3c4535f95ee5a3a3b47a744020a0
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-10 01:03:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/61b93d11d93a3ff6f1ca1efebcbe86f349826c1f', 'message': 'Allow gate_hook.sh to install only deps

This change is intended to improve the efficiency of preparing a host
to run the dsvm-functional tox env.  The goal is to install only
neutron and its dependencies rather than launching a full suite of
services and having to unstack.

In addition to supporting the configuration of a devstack gate node,
the gate_hook.sh script has been enhanced to support preparing an
arbitrary host to run the dsvm-functional tox env.  Details are
provided in TESTING.rst.

Change-Id: Iaf43be458bdf3c4535f95ee5a3a3b47a744020a0

'}, {'number': 21, 'created': '2015-02-04 22:54:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0069cbf2e603d27b917d05431b11eb2d6237b9c4', 'message': "Automate host configuration for functional testing

This change adds a new script, configure_for_func_testing.sh, that
automates configuration of a host to support functional testing.  The
script's functionality is consumed by a refactored version of
gate_hook.sh, and both minimizes runtime and removes the previous
dependency on the devstack-gate repo.

Additionally, the dsvm-functional tox env is no longer dependent on
devstack to deploy neutron's rootwrap configuration system-wide.
Rootwrap configuration is now automatically deployed to the target tox
venv before tests are run.

Change-Id: Iaf43be458bdf3c4535f95ee5a3a3b47a744020a0

This change adds a new script, configure_for_func_testing.sh, that
automates configuration of a host to support functional testing.  The
script's functionality is consumed by a refactored version of
gate_hook.sh, and both minimizes runtime and removes the previous
dependency on the devstack-gate repo.

Additionally, the dsvm-functional tox env is no longer dependent on
devstack to deploy neutron's rootwrap configuration system-wide.

commit_message:
Automate host configuration for functional testing

This change adds a new script, configure_for_func_testing.sh, that
automates configuration of a host to support functional testing.  The
script's functionality is consumed by a refactored version of
gate_hook.sh, and both minimizes runtime and removes the previous
dependency on the devstack-gate repo.

Additionally, the dsvm-functional tox env is no longer dependent on
devstack to deploy neutron's rootwrap configuration system-wide.
Rootwrap configuration is now deployed to the target tox venv on each
tox invocation.

Change-Id: Iaf43be458bdf3c4535f95ee5a3a3b47a744020a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/13/146113/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NEUTRON_PATH=${NEUTRON_PATH:-$BASE/new/neutron} IS_GATE=${IS_GATE:-True} DEVSTACK_PATH=${DEVSTACK_PATH:-$BASE/new/devstack} #TODO(marun) Need to error out if paths are not provided function _prepare_dev_env { cd $DEVSTACK_PATH if [[ -f localrc ]]; then mv localrc localrc.pre-gate-hook fi # Ensure os packages are installed for the target services # separately from a stack run. We don't want devstack to install # and run the services, just to have their dependencies installed. export ENABLED_SERVICES=mysql,rabbit,neutron,q-agt,q-l3 export INSTALL_TESTONLY_PACKAGES=True export FORCE_PREREQ=1 echo_summary "Installing package prerequisites" source ./tools/install_prereqs.sh # Run devstack to minimally configure the target host, as stack.sh # isn't modular enough to allow performing only the actions required. export ENABLED_SERVICES=rabbit export RABBIT_PASSWORD=secretrabbit echo_summary "Running devstack" ./stack.sh } function _prepare_gate_env { #TODO(marun) This is completely untested # Make the workspace owned by the stack user sudo chown -R stack:stack $BASE export ENABLED_SERVICES=rabbit export RABBIT_PASSWORD=secretrabbit export INSTALL_TESTONLY_PACKAGES=True echo "Running devstack" echo "... this takes 5 - 8 minutes (logs in logs/devstacklog.txt.gz)" start=$(date +%s) sudo -H -u stack stdbuf -oL -eL ./stack.sh > /dev/null end=$(date +%s) took=$((($end - $start) / 60)) if [[ "$took" -gt 15 ]]; then echo "WARNING: devstack run took > 15 minutes, this is a very slow node." fi } function _install_databases { export USE_SCREEN=False export DATABASE_PASSWORD=secretdatabase export MYSQL_PASSWORD=$DATABASE_PASSWORD source $DEVSTACK_PATH/lib/database} function _install_neutron { #TODO(marun) - need to ensure that the proper branch config is used in the gate DEST=${DEST:-/opt/stack} REQUIREMENTS_DIR=$DEST/requirements source $DEVSTACK_PATH/lib/neutron install_neutron install_neutronclient export ENABLED_SERVICES=q-agt,q-dhcp,q-l3 install_neutron_agent_packages _configure_neutron_common # Add a rootwrap filter to support test-only configuration (e.g. a # KillFilter for processes that use the python installed in a tox env). FUNC_FILTER=$NEUTRON_PATH/neutron/tests/contrib/filters.template sed -e "s+\$BASE_PATH+$NEUTRON_PATH/.tox/dsvm-functional+" \ $FUNC_FILTER | sudo tee /etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/functional.filters > /dev/null } source $DEVSTACK_PATH/functions source $DEVSTACK_PATH/lib/config source $DEVSTACK_PATH/stackrc # Common vars defined by stack.sh export TOP_DIR=$DEVSTACK_PATH # Alias required by devstack export FILES=$DEVSTACK_PATH/files export USE_SCREEN=False if [ "$venv" == "dsvm-functional" ] then IS_GATE=$(trueorfalse False $IS_GATE) if [[ $IS_GATE = "True" ]]; then _prepare_gate_env else GetDistro _prepare_dev_env fi _install_databases _install_neutron # Need to retain sudo until after the neutron rootwrap # configuration is installed. if [[ $IS_GATE = "True" ]]; then echo "Removing sudo privileges for devstack user" sudo rm /etc/sudoers.d/50_stack_sh fi source $DEVSTACK_PATH/lib/infra source $DEVSTACK_PATH/lib/tempest
deleted_lines: $BASE/new/devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate.sh # Source devstack functions to install the jobs dependencies TOP_DIR=$BASE/new/devstack source $TOP_DIR/functions source $TOP_DIR/lib/config source $TOP_DIR/stackrc source $TOP_DIR/localrc if [ "$venv" == "dsvm-functional" ] then # Add a rootwrap filter to support test-only # configuration (e.g. a KillFilter for processes that # use the python installed in a tox env). FUNC_FILTER=$BASE/new/neutron/neutron/tests/contrib/filters.template sed -e "s+\$BASE_PATH+$BASE/new/neutron/.tox/dsvm-functional+" \ $FUNC_FILTER | sudo tee /etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/functional.filters > /dev/null source $TOP_DIR/lib/database source $TOP_DIR/lib/infra source $TOP_DIR/lib/tempest

commit_message:
Fixes inconsistent Admin > Instances table header

Changes Instances table header to "Instances" rather than "All Instances"
so that it is consistent with the other tables in the Admin panel

Change-Id: Ie96806d55d2db6eaddbe0979170065b0968a2299
Closes-Bug: 1420293

commit_message:
Add support for PCI ports in OS::Neutron::Port

With the introduction of PCI Passthrough SR-IOV support in Neutron and Nova,
users can create PCI passthough ports.
This spec propose to add modify the resource type OS::Neutron::Port
to support PCI passthough ports.

Change-Id: I664356730cdcea2d43a27dae3fc1cc0d5ef56215
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/99/126399/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Add neutron resource for SR-IOV-PORT ==================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/neutron-resource-add-pci-port When creating Neutron SR-IOV ports, these ports should have their own resource types. This spec proposes to add OS::Neutron::PciPort objects. Problem description =================== A neutron port is a virtual port that is either attached to a linux bridge or an openvswitch bridge on a compute node. With the introduction of PCI Passthrough SR-IOV support, the intermediate virtual bridge is no longer required. Instead, the SR-IOV port is associated with a virtual function that is supported by the vNIC adaptor. Rather than modifying OS::Neutron::Port a new object type will be created for this type of port. Currently a PCI port can be created by setting the value_specs property in OS::Neutron::Port. However, having a new resource type will simplify the templates for the user and allow for different constraints in the future. Proposed change =============== Implement a new resource OS::Neutron::PciPort. This will reside with the current Neutron::Port and reuse as much of Neutron::Port as possible. The properties for OS::Neutron::PciPort will be as follows: .. code-block:: yaml resources: sriov_port: type: OS::Neutron::PciPort properties: network: { get_param: my_net } vnic_type: direct The vnics type supported are direct and macvtap Alternatives ------------ An alternate name could be OS::Neutron::SRIOV-Port Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Rob Pothier Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Kilo-1 Work Items ---------- * Add new OS::Neutron::PciPort Dependencies ============ None
